title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**About Enity Bank Group** 




 Enity is a challenger in the Nordic mortgage market, choosing to see the potential in people. Through inclusive, yet sustainable and responsible mortgage lending, we play an important role in supporting those who are often excluded by traditional banks.
 



  





 Since 2005, we have enabled financial empowerment for our customers, providing them access to the housing market or opportunities to get back on track through remortgage as well as offering high-yield savings accounts.
 



  





 Our brand portfolio includes Bluestep Bank, Bank2, and 60plusbanken. Together they serve customers across Sweden, Norway, and Finland, joined in a dedication to make banking simple, forward-looking, and accessible for more people.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We’re looking for a senior developer with a strong backend profile to help us modernize banking technology and create seamless digital experiences for our customers. If you enjoy solving complex problems and working with modern tech stacks, this is the role for you!
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




 As part of our cross-functional team, you’ll design, develop, and maintain secure, scalable applications for core banking. A key part of the role is modernizing legacy systems and transitioning them into a cloud-based, microservice-oriented architecture. You’ll collaborate closely with product owners, designers, and fellow developers to continuously improve our platforms and deliver high-quality user experiences.
 



  





**Tech stack** 




 Our tech stack includes
 


* .NET Core and C# for backend development
* SQL and stored procedures for data management
* RabbitMQ, messaging patterns, and REST APIs for integration and communication
* Azure, Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, and Docker for cloud infrastructure and deployment
* Angular, TypeScript, and ASP.NET MVC/Razor for frontend and server-side rendering



  





 While the role is backend-focused, you’ll occasionally interact with the frontend and infrastructure layers.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 We’re looking for someone with extensive experience in backend development using .NET and cloud technologies, ideally 5+ years. You are passionate about clean code, scalable architecture, and robust solutions. You enjoy collaborating, sharing knowledge, and contributing to a learning culture. Staying curious and keeping up with modern development practices comes naturally to you.
 



  





**We offer** 




 We offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where innovation is truly encouraged. With a hybrid work model (three days in the office and two remote), you’ll have the flexibility to balance work and life. We also provide great opportunities for career growth, including access to training and professional development. Plus, you’ll get to work with a modern tech stack on exciting challenges in the banking industry.
 



  





**Sound interesting?** 




 We would be happy to see your application as soon as possible, as the selection is ongoing. Please note that a valid work permit for Sweden is required for this position.
 



  





**Please note that this recruitment is managed by our external partner Safemind.
 *All* 
 applications are therefore submitted via Safemind's application form.**

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**👨‍💻 Senior Software Engineer – Web Tech Builder**
 MSAB is on the hunt for a Senior Software Engineer who gets a kick out of building stuff from scratch and geeking out with a crew of skilled coders. Our Unify Core Technology (UCT) team is all about creating the future of web dev at MSAB, and we want someone who loves rolling up their sleeves, simple, fast and maintainable code, and having a blast while doing it. Bonus: you’ll be helping fight crime!
   

  

 🚀 About MSAB
   

  

 We believe that you are dreaming of using your technical skills and your innovative mindset to create a better democratic world. Especially by solving crimes, gathering intelligence, investigating fraud and fighting corruption. At MSAB we make that dream come true!
   

  

 MSAB is one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies. We develop digital forensic solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used globally. Working with programming you will perform demanding tasks that tickles your innovative mindset and challenge your technical skills to find your way forward towards a solution.
   

  

**🎯 What You'll Be Doing**
* Building slick, high-performance web apps from the ground up, with a focus on speed and user happiness.
* Teaming up with a group of passionate nerds who love coding as much as you do.
* Shaping our web tech foundation by crafting tools and systems with serious attention to detail.
* Diving into binary formats, gRPC, and Protocol Buffers to make our systems hum.
* Using Playwright to write rock-solid tests that ensure our apps are bulletproof.


**🧠 What We're Looking For**
* A JavaScript/TypeScript wizard who knows their way around modern web dev.
* Handy with HTML, CSS, and Web APIs, making interfaces that are smooth and snappy.
* A bit obsessed with making things fast, sweating the small stuff that keeps apps zippy.
* Comfortable with binary formats, gRPC, and Protocol Buffers for tackling tricky data challenges.
* Pumped about building from scratch, skipping bloated frameworks, and creating lean, custom solutions.
* Someone who vibes with a team, loves sharing ideas, and enjoys a good code nerd-out.


**🧰 Our Tech Stack**
* HTML/CSS/TypeScript for clean, solid front-end code.
* Next.js SPA (React and React Router) for dynamic, speedy web apps.
* Caddy as our lightweight web server.
* gRPC-web for fast, scalable communication.
* Playwright for writing reliable, end-to-end tests.
* We keep dependencies light, building what we need with care and precision.


**🌍 What We Offer**
 Join a company that's making a real difference. At MSAB, you'll find a collaborative environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to be part of a mission that matters. We are working in a hybrid office model so you can meet your peers as well as working from home.
   

  

 MSAB is a world leader in forensic technology for extracting and analyzing data from mobile devices. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions for a safer world.
   

  

 MSAB deliver high quality digital forensic solutions to extract, review, analyze and manage data and are a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defense Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption. Our values encompass being an ethics-driven company focused on innovation and results.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Fullstack
description:
**Why is this role important**
 We’re building the world’s largest, most capable, and performant data platform for Marketing Intelligence. We have accomplished a lot, but we’re still early in our journey. Now, we are looking for Software Engineers to help us tackle the challenges ahead. If you’re curious to learn more about our data platform, here’s a blog post from our CTO.
   

  

*Our engineering department*
 We put a strong emphasis on team collaboration, we work in cross-functional teams, where you are not handed requirements, but rather problems to solve. Our Engineering teams have clear ownership and room to make decisions and priorities for our product. You engage and take responsibility for your part of the product with your peers. Learning is central to us. We work with small iterations and deploy to production several times a day.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 You will work with both frontend and backend and be responsible for everything from implementation to deployment and monitoring and we expect you to follow engineering best practices.
   

  

 We currently have several openings across the organization, focusing on areas like product navigation, onboarding, and platform connections. The whole product development department works from our central office in Stockholm to make it easier to collaborate.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack**
* Javascript/TypeScript
* Node
* React
* Microservice architecture in AWS


**What We're Looking For**
* 6+ years experience working as a developer in, at least parts of, our tech stack.
* Proficiency in both frontend and backend but might be more passionate about either.
* Knowledge in cloud development (we use AWS) and infrastructure.
* Interest and experience in thinking of scalability, security and reliability.
* Hands-on experience in agile teams and ways of working.
* Fluency in English.


**What You'll Bring**
 You're humble and you're not afraid to make important decisions. You see challenges as opportunities for growth, embrace learning, and persist in the face of setbacks.
   

  

 You have a strong drive for customer satisfaction, and you want to contribute to the success of your team! You understand how things work together and you can figure out solutions when things get complicated.
   

  

 You believe that the best solutions come from teamwork, where diverse perspectives and open communication is key. You enjoy collaborating within and across teams, as well as with adjacent departments such as design, product, and customers.
   

  

**Benefits & Perks**
 We offer a competitive salary along with great benefits.
   

  

 → Take a look at our Funnel benefits here!
   

  

**About**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting. Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Inclusiveness**
 Industry research shows that women and those in traditionally underrepresented groups generally don’t apply to jobs unless they check all the boxes for the role. If you feel you have what it takes for this role but don’t check 100% of the boxes—that’s okay—we encourage you to apply anyway and highlight what you can bring to the table.
   

  

**Office first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays however, we avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

**Relocation**
 For this role we are not considering applicants who require relocation and will take into consideration only applicants who are located in Stockholm, and:
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship
* Have a valid work permit for working in Sweden


 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Software Engineer (Fullstack) - Checkout
description:
**What We Do At Qliro**
 At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both here in Sweden and the Nordics.
   

  

 What your team does
   

  

 We are opening a software engineer position to our fullstack team Checkout Experience that is responsible for the checkout flow for our merchant's customers. We are building the best E-commerce checkout and payment widgets. Fullstack team with lots of humor, collaboration and go. The team is working in a hybrid setup, with a team day at the office each week, the other days everyone decides for themselves. You are sharing on call responsibility with the rest of the team - approximately once each six weeks.
   

  

 ✔ React, Redux, C#, .NET, AWS, Cypress, DynamoDB, Grafana
   

  

 ✔ A/B testing to generate statistics for future improvements
   

  

 ✔ Logging in NewRelic & Kibana
   

  

**What you will get to do** 
**👇**
* Work on different projects such as creating different versions of the checkout and new ways to pay, and exploring how we can utilize AWS services in the best way
* Work with technologies like .NET, React, Redux, AWS, GitLab, Terraform and more.
* Contribute to all stages of the product life-cycle, design, implementation, testing, releasing, and maintenance.
* Engage in architectural improvements and discussions.
* Collaborate constantly - We believe in teamwork and the value of practices like careful code reviews, pair (or mob) programming, and we are looking for individuals who share the same values.
* Learn new things continuously - We emphasize learning on the job as well as through our learning platform, and we also welcome you to share your knowledge with your colleagues.
* Have fun in an ever-growing area and organization.


**What you'll bring to your team
 **👇****
* 5+ years as a fullstack engineer
* Fearless to dive into architectural discussions and explore on your own
* You have worked with C#, .NET, and React
* If you have previous experience (technical or non-technical) from financial institutions, payments or e-commerce, that is also relevant
* You communicate without limitations in English, both in speech and writing. Swedish is not a prerequisite.


**WOW in everything we do**
 Qliro is the place for you who are curious, passionate, and love collaboration. Together we have the power to create wow in everything we do. Feel comfortable being you, bringing your own unique perspectives. At Qliro there is a place for you whoever you are. Differences are a strength.
   

  

 We love flexibility and remote work, we also believe in the power of meeting in real life. With a mix of working remotely and collaborating in the office, we believe in a flexible workplace that suits you and Qliro.

title: Product Developer H&M Women's - Regional Assortment
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 An exciting new opportunity has arisen for a Senior Product Developer to join our Regional Assortment Team at H&M. This position will be based in our Head office in Stockholm but will require some travel to India.
   

  

 As a Product Developer in this position, you will play a pivotal part in the process of shaping the H&M Women’s assortment for our Asian market and will tailor solutions to fit that individual customer's needs. You will define and execute both short- and long-term strategies for your category, ensuring alignment with our overall assortment goals. Leveraging your fashion intelligence, salesmanship, and commercial insight, you’ll identify seasonal keys and act on emerging trends. You will continuously refine our product and component strategy to drive growth and profitability.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who is a natural project leader, who will drive initiatives forward, ensuring seamless execution and effective cross-team collaboration in a fast-paced environment. You will also work alongside a talented team consisting of a product manager, planner, designer, and pattern maker, as well as collaborating closely with the wider production team. With your strong passion for product and fashion, you will be essential in creating world-class products that are on-trend and resonate with our customers.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Qualifications:
   

  

* Experience from a similar role as Product Developer
* Education in Textiles, Buying, or Product Development
* Preferably a proven track record in creating products for the womenswear customer with a high fashion level
* A keen eye for current fashion trends with strong fashion intelligence
* A deep passion for products and product development
* Extensive material knowledge
* Driven, structured, and proactive in taking initiatives
* Salesmanship and results-oriented
* Excellent communication skills
* A strong team player with a flexible attitude
* Ability to identify opportunities, improvements, and efficient solutions


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**JOIN US**
**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position, with placement in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV latest
 **13th of June** 
 . Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.)  If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
description:
**Job Description:**
 At Dentsu Data Sweden, we transform data into powerful insights that drive marketing innovation for some of the world’s most iconic brands. We’re looking for a Senior BI Developer with 3–5 years of experience to join our dynamic team and lead the development of cutting-edge business intelligence solutions. If you're passionate about data, storytelling through dashboards, and collaborating with cross-functional teams, this is your opportunity to make a real impact!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the full lifecycle of BI projects—from architecture and design to development, testing, and deployment.
* Act as the BI subject matter expert, defining best practices and ensuring high-quality data models and reporting layers.
* Collaborate with clients and internal teams to gather requirements and deliver tailored dashboards and reports.
* Design and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI and other visualization tools.
* Develop and manage data pipelines across SQL Server, Snowflake, and BigQuery.
* Ensure data quality and structure for use in advanced analytics and econometric models.
* Optimize dashboard performance and maintain solutions as data sources evolve.
* Manage user access and report scheduling within BI platforms.
* Communicate complex data insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.


**Qualifications**
* 3–5 years of experience in BI development and dashboard creation.
* Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with databases like SQL Server, Snowflake, and BigQuery.
* Expertise in Power BI; familiarity with other visualization tools is a plus.
* Experience with ETL tools (Supermetrics preferred).
* Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (preferred), Azure, or AWS.
* Programming experience in Python (preferred) and/or R.
* Understanding of media planning and buying is a plus.
* Familiarity with AdTech platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, and Google Analytics is advantageous.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* Team-oriented with a collaborative mindset and a passion for sharing knowledge.
* Ability to present complex information in a clear, structured, and engaging way.


**What We Offer:**
* An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
* A challenging role in a fast-growing market
* Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
* 40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
* Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
* A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
* Competitive salary and great benefits
* Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
* Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
* Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
* Collective agreements
* 30 days holiday entitlement


**About DD & Dentsu**
 Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centred transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.
   

  

 DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings.
   

  

**Diversity and Inclusion**
 At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.
   

  

**Additional information:**
 Please do not hesitate to send in your application and CV/LinkedIn profile as soon as possible.
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Dentsu Media
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: Lead Logistics Developer
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a** 
**Lead Logistics Developer** 
**🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

 We are looking for a Logistic Developer to join our team. You will take charge of an efficient and effective logistics day-to-day operation.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you are innovative, pragmatic, and creative, with a positive spirit and a curious, entrepreneurial mindset. Valued by your peers, you enjoy connecting with a wide network, fostering win-win solutions, and building strong relationships.
   

  

 You have a strong ability to turn ideas into action in a structured and organized manner. You are approachable and equally comfortable working hands-on as you are leading strategic discussions.  Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.

title: Software Test Automation Engineer
company_industry: Biotechnology Research, Research Services, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Software Test Automation Engineer** 
 to join our team with strong experience in C# and Python programming, as well as expertise in test automation for C# .NET applications. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining automated test frameworks and scripts to ensure the quality and reliability of our software products. This role requires a deep understanding of software testing methodologies, automation tools, and CI/CD pipelines.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain automated test scripts for functional, regression, integration, and performance testing of C# .NET applications.
* Design and implement test automation frameworks using C# and Python to support scalable and maintainable automation strategies.
* Collaborate with developers, QA teams, and product managers to define test requirements and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
* Requires 20% of manual testing and testing a legacy product, the focus should be on maintaining stability, ensuring compatibility, and identifying regression issues.
* Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines using , TeamCity CI/CD, or GitHub Action.
* Conduct API testing using tools like Postman, RestAssured, or SoapUI and automate backend validations.
* Perform test execution, analyze results, report defects, and work closely with development teams for issue resolution.
* Maintain and enhance existing automation frameworks to improve reliability and efficiency.
* Implement performance and load testing strategies using tools like JMeter, Locust, or k6.
* Stay updated on industry best practices, tools, and technologies in test automation.


**Required Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* Strong proficiency in C# and Python programming with hands-on experience in automation scripting.
* Experience in test automation for C# .NET applications using frameworks like Selenium WebDriver, SpecFlow, NUnit.
* Expertise in API testing and automation for RESTful and SOAP services.
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD integration and version control tools like Git.
* Strong understanding of software testing methodologies, including Agile, DevOps, and Shift-left testing.
* Familiarity with cloud-based testing solutions and containerization tools like Docker/Kubernetes is a plus.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in a collaborative environment.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience in security and accessibility testing.
* Knowledge of AWS Cloud testing environments.
* ISTQB or other relevant test automation certifications

title: C++ Developer

title: Data Scientist in Husqvarna Groups new AI org!
company_industry: Mechanical Or Industrial Engineering, Consumer Goods, and Automotive
description:
*Imagine a place where your passion for technology meets the thrill of innovation. Picture yourself as part of a dynamic team, driving tangible business impact - through innovative AI solutions.
 **Welcome to our world!***
**About this opportunity:**
 This is a chance to be part of a team that's passionate about building something meaningful. The thrill of working on research projects that push the boundaries of technology, a collaborative environment where your ideas are valued and your contributions make a real impact. The opportunity to proactively drive the agenda - and
 **shape the future of AI.**
 Here, we are a close-knit team of people working in data, AI and cloud, with colleagues both in India and in Sweden.
 **Our mission?** 
 To scale AI - and pioneer forward-leading technology, ensuring we stay ahead of the curve and deliver impactful solutions.
   

  

**You will:**
 As a Data Scientist, you'll be at the heart of our innovation. You'll dive into data, build models, fine-tune algorithms, and deploy solutions in cloud environments. You'll collaborate with data architects, cloud experts, software developers and other IT specialists, weaving together your expertise - to create something extraordinary.
   

  

* Develop and deliver AI solutions, including data pre-processing, analysis, modelling, deployment, and maintenance.
* Design, install, test, and maintain data management systems, to meet business requirements.
* Implement scripts for database maintenance, deployment, and ETL operations.
* Manage cloud services (AWS, Azure) and relevant cloud storage systems.
* Monitor data performance and modify infrastructure, to improve pipelines and models.
* Document feature lists, user stories, and roadmaps aligned with the product vision.
* Stay updated with technology trends in data science, data engineering, and AI.
* Execute academic and research projects relevant to the AI organization.
* Support ideation processes with technical and entrepreneurial expertise.
* Identify business opportunities through technology-driven innovation.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing activities, to elevate company expertise in AI.


**Who We're Looking For:**
 A great communicator - in the realm of technology. Maybe you’ve started your journey in software development - and found your way into the world of AI. Maybe you've worked in startups (or another innovative environment), where you didn't just code - you pitched ideas, drove innovation, and created solutions that made a
 *difference* 
 . In any environment, you see opportunity in uncertainty, and you like to challenge yourself to learn new areas.
   

  

 Your craftsmanship in writing exceptional code and delivery of high-quality productsare your strengths. And let's not forget your
 **social skills** 
 , you're not just a coder; you are also a team-player, a communicator, an innovator, who knows how to communicate complex concepts effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

**Your Skills and Qualifications:**
* A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field and at least 5 years of experience in developing and delivering data and AI solutions, as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Software Developer, or similar role. Knowledge of Python, SQL
* Familiarity with big data technologies, like Spark.
* Experience leading and collaborating on cross-functional projects.
* Experience with developing prescriptive solutions to support decision making and experimentation.


**Location:**
 Location for this position is in Sweden at one of our offices in
 **Huskvarna** 
 ,
 **Jonsered** 
 or
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

 But, with our hybrid working environment, you'll have the flexibility to work both onsite and remotely, promoting work-life balance for all team members. We meet in the office at least 2-3 days a week (50%).
   

  

**Your application:**
 The last day to apply is 2025-06-21,
 *but note that we will make an ongoing selection.* 
  

  

 For questions regarding the process, please contact Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Matilda Nordén matilda.norden@husqvarnagroup.com.
   

  

**About Husqvarna:**
*Husqvarna Group is a global leader in innovative solutions for managing forests, parks, and gardens, as well as cutting equipment and diamond tools for the light construction and stone industries. With an innovative mindset, we are dedicated to deliver high-quality solutions ranging from robotic mowers to chainsaws, watering systems and power cutters, with a strong focus on our customers and future generations.*
*Founded in the Swedish town Huskvarna in 1689, we have been pioneers in our business for more than three centuries. Today, we are mainly operating under the Husqvarna and Gardena brands, serving consumers and professionals in over 100 countries through direct sales, dealers, and retailers. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, Husqvarna Group employs approximately 13,300 people in 40 countries and reported net sales of SEK 48,4 billion in 2024.* 
*Husqvarna Group is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.*
**Last date to apply:**
 21 June 2025

title: Software Engineer (Backend) - Clearings & Settlements
description:
**Qliro is all about safe and simple payments.** 
*We are a payment provider who loves to help customers purchase online without even thinking about the payment part. We are also a dedicated payment partner to our merchants who serve customers every day. Since our start in 2014 we’ve grown into becoming one of the most loved payment providers in the Nordics, working with some of the largest e-commerce companies to provide safe and simple payments.*
 Clearing & Settlements is a team working with financial aspects of Payments such as ledgers, book keeping, settlements reconciliation, and payouts. We are working in a modern microservices and cloud environment, mainly backend with some limited frontend in a back-office application. This is an international team characterised by a high seniority. Based on this, we can now onboard an engineer early in their career with one to a few years’ experience. The team is working in a hybrid setup, with a team day at the office each week, the other days everyone decides for themselves.
   

  

**Current focus for the team:**
 ✔ Building high quality software solutions using C#, .NET 8 and onwards
   

  

 ✔ Develop event-driven and microservices-based architecture solutions
   

  

 ✔ C#, .NET, AWS, Terraform, GitLab, Event Driven Architecture, RabbitMQ, SNS, SQS, Lambda, ECS, EKS Batch, Cloudwatch, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Postgresql
   

  

**What we are looking for in our new team member:**
 👩‍💻You have done some development within C# .Net, if you have worked with other parts of our stack, this is beneficial
   

  

 🚀 You have practical experience from working with agile engineering methods combined with a basic understanding of software engineering best practices
   

  

 ☁️ This team is 100% in the AWS cloud, so any experience working with cloud technologies and Infrastructure-as-Code is relevant.
   

  

 🙌 Previous understanding or knowledge with different testing methods and frameworks
   

  

 🤖 You have an understanding of system design, data structures, API development and algorithms
   

  

 💰 If you have experience from working with finance and payments solution (technical or non technical) like payment processing or compliance is an advantage
   

  

**WOW in everything we do**
 Qliro is the place for you who are curious, passionate and love collaboration. Together we have the power to create wow in everything we do. Feel comfortable being you, bringing your own unique perspectives. At Qliro there is a place for you whoever you are. Differences are a strength.
   

  

 We love flexibility and remote work, we also believe in the power of meeting in real life. With a mix of working remote and collaborating in the office, we believe in a flexible workplace that suits you and Qliro.

title: Fullstack utvecklare med erfarenhet av Angular till kund inom elhandel - Castra
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.*
 Om rollen
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som brinner för att skapa snygga, smarta och användarvänliga lösningar till ett uppdrag hos kund som jobbar med elhandel och balanshantering. Du kommer att arbeta nära produktteamet med att utveckla gränssnitt och funktioner som gör verklig skillnad för våra användare. Rollen passar dig som både gillar att skriva snygg kod och har ett öga för UX och design.
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av webbutveckling
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Angular
* Goda kunskaper i TypeScript, Angular och REST API:er
* Erfarenhet av databaser, t.ex. MySQL
* Mycket god förståelse för JavaScript/TypeScript samt god koll på semantisk HTML och CSS
* Erfarenhet av .Net / C#


 Dina egenskaper
   

  

 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:
   

  

* Har ett stort intresse för användarupplevelse och en känsla för design och detaljer
* Värdesätter hög kodkvalitet och skriver ren, underhållbar och välstrukturerad kod
* Har god förståelse för webben som plattform — hur webbläsare fungerar och bästa praxis kring säkerhet och prestanda
* Är van att arbeta med prestandafrågor och vet hur man både hittar och förebygger problem
* Gillar att vara med och diskutera tekniska lösningar och bidra i beslut kring arkitektur
* Är en lagspelare med positiv energi och prestigelös inställning


**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
   

  

**Om Castra**
 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
   

  

 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se eller 0728716312
