title: IT-Säkerhetspecialist - Castra
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*
**Rollen**
 I rollen som IT-säkerhetsspecialist kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder för att identifiera säkerhetsutmaningar, utveckla strategier och implementera tekniska lösningar som skyddar deras digitala tillgångar. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:
   

  

* Genomföra säkerhetsanalyser och riskbedömningar
* Utveckla och implementera säkerhetslösningar för IAM, nätverk, molnmiljöer och applikationer
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av regelverk så som GDPR, NIS2, ISO 27001 m.fl.
* Följa upp och övervaka säkerhetsincidenter samt genomföra åtgärder
* Rådgivning till kunder om bästa praxis inom IT-säkerhet


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-säkerhet
* Kunskaper inom områden som IAM, nätverkssäkerhet, kryptering och molnsäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsstandarder och regelverk som GDPR, NIS2, ISO 27001 eller liknande.
* Förmåga att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med säkerhetslösningar
* Certifieringar som CISSP, CISM eller liknande är meriterande


 Låter detta som du i det stora hela? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan, så tar vi ett möte redan under kommande vecka!
   

  

**Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**
 Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet.
   

  

 Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser. Det låter lite skrytsamt, förlåt. Men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av Great Place to Work och har de senaste tre åren blivit utnämnda till en av Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser. Som grädde på moset är vi även Gasell- och Karriärföretag.
   

  

 På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara ytterligare ett bevis. Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Summan av kardemumman är att hos oss är möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.
   

  

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Eskilstuna, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping.*
 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**
 Sök direkt via länken eller hör av dig till Charlotta Ljung på Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se eller 072-871 63 12

title: Founder's Executive Assistant - Stockholm
description:
Come and build something monumental for Healthcare!
   

  

 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

***Please Note:** 
 Applications will close EOD June 19th. We will not review applications until this date so take your time to apply - you don't have to be first and all applications will be reviewed!*
**About The Role**
 We are on the lookout for a brilliant, highly organized individual to act as a trusted day-to-day enabler for our founders, while also ensuring that our office runs smoothly. This isn’t your average EA role - it’s an opportunity to be at the heart of one of Europe’s fastest growing tech-companies.
   

  

 From managing packed calendars to planning office after works and supporting internal workflows, you’ll play a key role in reducing friction and enabling the leadership team to do their best work. Partnering closely with our CEO and Chief of Staff in particular, you’ll shape the engine of Tandem as we grow from startup to global player. If you’re proactive, detail-obsessed, and love bringing structure to chaos – we want you on the team!
   

  

 What You will Do
   

  

* Own and optimize the calendar, inbox and daily logistics of our CEO, helping bring clarity and prioritize what matters most.
* Supporting our CCO and CTO as needed with managing scheduling and travel with precision and foresight.
* Collaborate closely with our Chief of Staff and provide hands-on administrative support – from shaping internal process improvements to executing ad-hoc tasks.
* Keep our Stockholm HQ running smoothly by managing day-to-day office operations, coordinating with vendors, handling supplies, and creating a welcoming, well-organized environment for the team.
* Organize and support internal events - like afterworks, fikas, and casual celebrations - to foster a vibrant, social, and connected workplace culture.


 What You Bring
   

  

* A few years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Project Coordinator, or Office Manager – ideally in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills – you're structured, dependable, and thrive on juggling multiple priorities.
* Clear and confident communicator – able to engage effectively with senior stakeholders, internal teams, and external partners.
* Proactive and solution-oriented – you take initiative, anticipate needs, and enjoy making life easier for others.
* Trustworthy and calm – you handle sensitive information with care and sound judgment, while bringing clarity even on the busiest days.
* Tech-savvy and quick to learn – comfortable with Microsoft Office, Slack, Notion, and project tools.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Exposure to supporting founders or senior leaders in technology and/or growth settings.
* Interest in the healthcare space and a desire to contribute to a mission-driven company.


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We will consider applications until
 **EOD on June 19th 2025** 
 , so please make sure to apply with your CV in English before then. Applications will be reviewed thereafter.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our Chief of Staff
* Follow up interview with our CEO and Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
 Culture at Tandem
   

  

 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: Teamledare it
emails: robert.maric@skatteverket.se, matilda.sandring@skatteverket.se, nastasha.mattsson@skatteverket.se, daniel.bynander@skatteverket.se, jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se
description:
Vill du jobba i en komplex miljö med en samhällsviktig funktion som ligger i teknikens framkant? Här finns stora möjligheter för dig som vill utvecklas både på djupet och bredden inom ett eller flera områden. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 I din roll som teamledare leder du ett eller flera agila team där varje person har expertkunskap inom sitt teknikområde. I vår utveckling av it-infrastrukturen arbetar vi agilt med stöd av ramverket IT4IT och metoden Scrum.
   

  

 Som teamledare utövar du agilt ledarskap genom att bistå teamet att tillämpa ett agilt arbetssätt, etablera teamregler, estimera teamets arbete och redovisa teamets framdrift. Du leder agila ceremonier så som sprintplanering, stå upp möten, demos och retrospektiv. Du hanterar dessutom kommunikation och koordinering med andra utvecklingsteam och stöttar i planering och genomförande av den gemensamma utvecklingsplaneringen i s.k. ”Big Room Planning”.
   

  

 Du är placerad i Sundbyberg och är en del av enheten Skatteverkets Tekniska Tjänster (STT). Vi ansvarar för utveckling, underhåll och drift och levererar tjänster inom it infrastruktur, plattformar och it arbetsplats till flera myndigheter: Skatteverket, Kronofogden, Valmyndigheten, Utbetalningsmyndigheten samt Myndigheten för Digital förvaltning. Vi har dessutom precis fått uppdraget att leverera it-tjänster till ännu fler myndigheter!
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation med cirka 1500 medarbetare kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* förstå vikten av att skapa relationer med andra team för att nå de uppsatta målen
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker och kunna ställa om vid förändringar
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband och avgränsa.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* eftergymnasial utbildning inom it alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av ledande roll inom it så som exempelvis Scrum Master eller Teamledare


 Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt. Det är även önskvärt med kunskap inom Jira och/eller Confluence. Det är vidare önskvärt med erfarenhet av att arbeta med it inom en större organisation.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Observera att rekryteringsteamet har semester under veckorna 29-33, vilket kan innebära längre svarstider under denna period. Vi tackar för din förståelse och återkopplar dig så snart vi kan vid frågor.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/509 | Kontakt: Robert Maric, HR-specialist rekrytering robert.maric@skatteverket.se, Matilda Sandring, HR-specialist rekrytering matilda.sandring@skatteverket.se, Nastasha Mattsson, Rekryterande chef nastasha.mattsson@skatteverket.se, Daniel Bynander, Rekryterande chef daniel.bynander@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-06-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-18

title: IT & Engineering Professionals – Talent Pipeline
description:
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Are you an experienced professional seeking new challenges in Sweden? We are building a
 **talent pipeline** 
 for future openings across a broad range of sectors. Whether you specialize in
 **information technology, engineering, or project leadership** 
 , we want to connect with you.
   

  

**Why join our Talent Network?**
* Access to exclusive job openings aligned with your expertise
* Stay informed on upcoming opportunities in your field
* Connect with leading employers across Sweden
* Accelerate your job search through proactive recruitment


**We're looking for experienced professional in:**
* Information Technology & Digital Innovation Software Development & Engineering Cloud & Infrastructure Cybersecurity AI & Machine Learning DevOps & IT Operations Functional & Non-functional IT Roles IT & Technical Project Management
* Engineering & Technical Fields Electrical & Electronic Engineering Manufacturing Engineering Chemical Engineering Quality Engineering
* Other Professional Domains Project & Program Management Business Analysis Systems Engineering...and more


**Ideal candidates will have:**
* Minimum 4 years of professional experience in Sweden
* A valid Swedish work permit
* Strong expertise in your domain
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at kumud@vipas.se
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and specify your
 **preferred professional area(s)** 
 . Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Senior Systems Engineer – Rail Signaling & Embedded Systems
description:
**Shape the Future of Rail Technology with Multiply** 




 Are you passionate about advancing railway technology and eager to work on high-impact mobility solutions? At
 **Multiply** 
 , we deliver end-to-end IT and engineering services, combining expert consulting with powerful tools like
 **VisFlow** 
 , our in-house flow visualization and analytics platform. We work where innovation meets precision—multiplying value by aligning people, process, and technology.
 



 As a
 **Senior Systems Engineer** 
 , you’ll join Multiply on assignment for a
 **global leader in rail transport** 
 —a company at the forefront of delivering high-speed trains, metros, trams, e-buses, infrastructure, signaling systems, and digital mobility solutions. You will play a critical role in the development of
 **trackside and onboard safety systems** 
 that power the future of public transport.
 


 🔧
 **Your Role** 
* Contribute to the full system lifecycle: from architecture and requirements to integration, verification, and safety certification.
* Work on
 **embedded software and hardware systems** 
 for onboard subsystems such as communication interfaces, safety controllers, and train control units.
* Interface with
 **trackside signaling systems and railway infrastructure** 
 such as interlockings, cabling, and detection systems.
* Support compliance with
 **CENELEC (EN 50126/8/9)** 
 , safety and RAMS processes, and participate in technical reviews and audits.


 ✅
 **Your Profile** 
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Systems Engineering, Embedded Systems, Electrical Engineering, or similar.
* 5+ years of experience working in
 **rail signaling** 
 , including embedded development or systems integration in
 **safety-critical environments** 
 .
* Experience with systems like interlockings, onboard units, train-to-ground communication, or detection and control interfaces.
* Familiar with structured engineering processes (V-model, systems lifecycle), configuration management, and tools like
 **DOORS, Polarion, Git** 
 .
* Methodical and collaborative; able to
 **communicate clearly across disciplines and document your work reliably** 
 .
* Fluent in English;
 **Swedish required or willingness to learn** 
 .
* Based in Sweden or open to relocation.


 🌟
 **Why Join Multiply?** 

 At Multiply, we don’t just place consultants—we empower technical experts to do their best work:
 


* You’ll work in high-impact assignments at globally leading companies in rail and mobility.
* You’ll join a consultancy that values curiosity, craftsmanship, and autonomy, and gives you tools like
 **VisFlow** 
 to accelerate delivery and insight.
* You’ll be part of a collaborative and supportive culture that’s focused on meaningful, long-term development.

title: Senior Manager IT Audit (m/f/d)
description:
**We are looking for a
   

  

 Senior Manager IT Audit (** 
**m/f/d)**
**(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our locations in Berlin, Verl, and Amsterdam – flexible working conditions available**
**What You Bring To This Position**
* Completed studies in either Computer Science, IT Security, Information Security, Cyber Security, IT Governance/Management, or a related discipline.
* 5+ years of experience in auditing or consulting companies in regulated industries, ideally in the financial sector, focusing on IT/Tech.
* Specialized knowledge in Access Controls, API and Web Service Security, Configuration Management, Cloud Security, Authentication and Authorization, Secure Communication, and Penetration Testing.
* Best practices experience in end-to-end IT audits, including scoping, fieldwork, reporting, and follow-up activities, following a risk-based auditing, including control testing.
* Experience with standards such as ISO 27001:2022, BSI C5, ITIL, and COBIT is advantageous.
* You have excellent English language skills; German language skills are a big plus.
* Certifications such as CISA, CISM, CRISC, CISSP, Azure AZ/DP, or AWS “Certified” are highly advantageous.
* You are willing to travel nationally and internationally (up to 20%) when needed, while 80% working from home is possible.


**What will be your challenge?**
* Plan audits on a short-term, mid-term, and long-term risk-based approach.
* Conduct internal audits focused on tech areas within the regulated and non-regulated entities of Riverty.
* Coordinate audit requests and perform audit defense on external IT assessments in the second line of defense.
* Report directly to management about audit results and consolidate results to show trends to management.
* Discuss mitigating measures with the auditees and follow up on the mitigation plans in a planned manner.
* Ensure compliance with internal and external information security-related requirements, such as DORA, PCI-DSS, ISO 27001, or ISO 22301.
* Additionally, you will plan and execute third—and partly fourth-party audits in the context of the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA).


 #EUR13
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Kundprojektledare - Jönköping
description:
🚀
 **Gå med i vårt team på VIPAS AB!** 
 🚀
   

  

 Har du vad som krävs för att trivas i den dynamiska IT-konsultvärlden? VIPAS AB, ett växande företag, bjuder in dig att ta del av nästa spännande projekt som vår nya medarbetare!
   

  

**Om VIPAS:**
 Föreställ dig en värld där din affärsteknik är perfekt anpassad till dina mål – effektiv, skalbar och innovativ. På VIPAS AB är det precis vad vi strävar efter att skapa. Som ett IT-konsultföretag erbjuder vi inte bara tjänster, vi levererar skräddarsydda lösningar med hjälp av den senaste tekniken som Java och Python. Vårt team har gedigen erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling, DevOps och ingenjörskonst, och vi leder er genom den moderna teknikens landskap med trygghet och framförhållning.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning:**
 Kundprojektledare för större systemprojekt (CTC).
   

  

 Projektledaren är ansvarig för genomförande av projekt, att projektmålen uppfylls och att villkoren som finns i dokumenterade uppdragsbeskrivningar blir genomförda. Projektledaren är ansvarig gentemot uppdragsgivaren i frågor som rör projektet.
   

  

**Krav:**
* Söker senior PM med mångårig erfarenhet av internationalla systemprojekt med fysiska produktleveranser
* Behöver kunna agera med kort startsträcka.
* Tillgänglighet önskas omgående.


**Meriterande**
* Tidigare erfarenhet av Trainings produktportfölj är mycket meriterande.


**Ansvar**
* Se till att projektet drivs i överensstämmelse med fastlagda processer, policy, strategier samt gällande lagar och förordningar
* Att leda arbetet och att tillsammans med projektmedlemmar etablera en målbild, tidplan och en projektorganisation för att kunna driva projektet så effektivt som möjligt.
* Ansvarar för genomförandet av aktiviteter enligt projektplanen samt uppföljning och rapportering av projektet. Är ansvarig för att projektet behandlar uppkomna avvikelser.
* Ansvarar för att hålla projektets fastslagna budget och följa upp denna.
* Planera, genomföra och kommunicera formella projektmöten med kund och/eller uppdragsgivare. Samt att ha projektmöten med sina projektmedlemmar för att följa upp progress, att alla jobbar mot samma mål, att tillsammans uppdatera tidplanen.
* Skall månadsvis uppdatera projektets prognos till avslut baserat på framdriften och ekonomiska utfall.
* Att rapportera statusen för projektet
* Ansvariga för att identifiera och förmedla nya affärsmöjligheter inom pågående projekt
* Hantera alla kundkontakter inom gällande projekt, i kontrakts frågor i samråd med marknadsansvarig
* Hantera kontakter med partners inom det gällande projektet i samråd med inköpsansvarig.
* Skall agera när problem riskerar att uppstå i någon del i projektet, om möjligt innan dessa är ett faktum.
* Ska stödja sina projektmedlemmar i deras arbete med fokus på projektteamets samarbete.


**Befogenheter**
* Attestera ekonomiska transaktioner inom ramen för gällande attestinstruktion, API-56.
* Delegera ansvar och befogenheter genom en dokumenterad uppdragsbeskrivning.
* Acceptera eller avvisa inleveranser till projektet (produkt/ tjänst/ dokumentation).
* Stoppa utleveranser som inte håller rätt kvalitet.


 Sysselsättningsgrad 100% på plats i kundens lokaler
   

  

**Varför jobba hos oss?**
 VIPAS AB erbjuder attraktiva anställningspaket för IT-konsulter, i enlighet med Teknikföretagens (Almega) kollektivavtal. Att arbeta med oss innebär möjligheter inom olika branscher, vilket ger dig flexibilitet och möjligheter till utveckling. Om du är drivande och redo att anta nya utmaningar, är VIPAS familjen för dig!
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av ett innovativt team som driver framtiden inom telekom, fordon, detaljhandel och bank. Om du är redo att ta dig an utmanande projekt och växa i en banbrytande miljö, är detta möjligheten för dig!
   

  

**Ansök nu**
 Tveka inte att kontakta oss på
 **swati@vipas.se**
**Observera:** 
 Ansök om du har
 **Sveriges PR/citizenship** 
 eller ett
 **arbetstillstånd för Sverige** 
 .
   

  

**Hur ansöker du:**
 Intresserade kandidater uppmanas att skicka in sitt CV och personliga brev. Gå med oss och driv innovation på VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Observera att vi rekryterar löpande, vilket innebär att uppdraget kan stängas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Om du är intresserad rekommenderar vi att du ansöker omedelbart!

title: IT Manager
description:
📍 Stockholm
   

  

 📆 As soon as possible
   

  

 👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week
   

  

 📚 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 Do you have a passion for software, a keen eye for detail, and a desire to keep an organization running smoothly? Precis is seeking a dynamic IT Manager to oversee and manage all central IT functions within our organization. In this role, you will leverage your technical expertise to ensure the seamless operation, support, and development of our IT infrastructure while driving larger-scale projects and integrations forward.
   

  

 At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
   

  

 Are you curious to learn more about us? Read more about us here. For insights into what life is like at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
   

  

 We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead and oversee all aspects of our IT operations, with a focus on strategic project execution.
* Manage the software lifecycle, including procurement, deployment, configuration, and maintenance (incl. Ongoing performance and Security).
* Collaborate closely with the Operations team to ensure seamless system integration and alignment with organizational objectives.
* Implement and administer directory services (e.g., Microsoft Entra, Google Workspace) for user authentication and authorization.
* Lead and mentor IT colleagues, providing guidance and support in day-to-day operations and professional development.
* Proactively drive optimization efforts across the IT infrastructure, leveraging your technical expertise to streamline processes and enhance functionality and security.
* Support and maintain hardware and network infrastructure.
* Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies and industry trends, recommending innovative solutions to enhance our IT capabilities.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Minimum 3 years of experience in a software administration or IT managing role
* Extensive knowledge of IT systems, infrastructure and software administration, with a demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues.
* Proven experience with directory services (e.g., Microsoft Entra, Google Workspace) and processes like SAML and SSO.
* Experience working with APIs (e.g., REST API) for integration and optimization to design, integrate, and deploy efficient solutions.
* Experience with Python and SQL is highly valued.
* Leadership skills within IT area, with the ability to inspire and mentor team members
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen eye for identifying opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong communication skills, and ability to translate complex technical information
* Basic understanding of hardware components and network connectivity.


**What We Offer**
*You can read our full offering in our* 
*handbook.*
* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting. The salary bracket for this position is 47 000 - 56 000
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: Solution Architect Fixed Income for the Trading Technology Area at SEB in Stockholm
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Do you want to be part of strengthening SEB's market position in Fixed Income? We're currently looking for a Solution Architect to join our team. By joining Fixed Income, you'll become part of a leading player in the Fixed Income space within the Nordics, offering a broad product portfolio for investors, including interest-bearing instruments and associated derivatives, advisory services, and comprehensive financial solutions.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Solution Architect within Technology Trading, you will be part of a team accountable for driving SEB's architectural agenda for Fixed Income. Your responsibility will be to evolve the architecture in line with the business objectives for Fixed Income with a focus on Cloud, Data, API and Security. You will be responsible for the driving the strategic agenda for the application portfolio, designing solutions, providing options, and detailing roadmaps towards the architectural target state.
   

  

 The architecture team within Trading consists of Solution Architects led by a Domain Architect. Together we strive to have a broad range of competencies and skills in technologies and business domain knowledge. We like to collaborate and team up to do great things together.
   

  

 But that’s not all – you’ll also be part of the Fixed Income Tribe, which includes teams from Trading Technology and Trading Services, all working together to support the Fixed Income business.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience in designing architectures that integrate diverse technologies and platforms
* Broad interest in various architecture domains, including business, application, information, and technology
* Expertise in designing and developing systems, with a focus on APIs, modularity, TTD, and data
* Experience working with regulations and directives
* Proven stakeholder management and communication skills, both with business and IT
* Strong drive, proactive attitude, and ability to take ownership and execute
* Strategic mindset with experience in developing roadmaps to guide the transition to target architectures
* Experience in cyber security and security architecture is merited
* Fluency in English


**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Opportunities to help transform an industry
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Deliver world-class service to customers


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than
 **May 31st, 2025** 
 . If you have questions about the position, please contact Andreas Höjgård, andreas.hojgard@seb.se ,
 **but we will not process applications via email.**
 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

description:

title: Solution Architect for API Solutions | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Shape the future of SEB's API platform as our next Solution Architect!
   

  

 SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you? About the role: As a Solution Architect in the API area, you’ll play a crucial role in building our API-driven platform and governance. You will contribute to the transformation of our API platforms, a highly prioritized area, ensuring seamless integrations for both our internal and external customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the architectural work within the API area.
* Mentor and guide development teams in adopting API standards and practices.
* Coordinate the architecture change agenda for API solutions in the Business Infrastructure domain.
* Support various API transition initiatives with your expertise and experience.
* Act as an advisor to stakeholders on both the business and technology sides.
* Drive innovation by designing scalable and secure API solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align API strategies with business goals.
* Ensure the reliability and performance of API services through best practices and continuous improvement.
* Influence the future direction of our API strategies.


**To Thrive In This Role We Believe You Have**
* Experience in architecture within the API domain.
* Hands-on experience working with APIs and API platforms.
* Ability to model, visualize, and communicate architectural solutions across various technologies and platforms.
* Familiarity with modern development paradigms such as event-driven architecture, microservices, and cloud.
* Excellent communication skills, bridging both business and IT.
* Previous experience in the financial industry is a plus.
* Proficiency in English.


**Bonus Points For Experience With**
* DevOps and Continuous Delivery.
* Microservices architecture and REST APIs.
* Authentication protocols like OpenID Connect (OIDC) and OAuth.


**Ready to join?**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to this role. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than January 30th, 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager Lars Lindgren lars.lindgren@seb.se (we will not process applications via email)

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Technical Project Manager 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Technical Project Manager.**
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are seeking an experienced
 **Technical Project Manager** 
 to support our client in the automotive industry with the implementation and coordination of
 **EU CO₂ legislation and compliance processes** 
 . This is a critical role where you will lead the interpretation and integration of the 3rd amendment of EU CO₂ regulations into the organization's processes and ensure continuous compliance with existing legal requirements.
   

  

 You will work in a highly collaborative and cross-functional environment, engaging with engineering, development, and regulatory teams to secure regulatory alignment and drive sustainable mobility initiatives.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead the interpretation and implementation of the 3rd amendment of EU CO₂ legislation.
* Coordinate ongoing efforts to maintain and manage CO₂-related compliance processes.
* Serve as the central point of contact for regulatory alignment across teams and departments.
* Facilitate cross-functional collaboration between engineering, compliance, and development teams.
* Identify and mitigate project risks related to legal compliance and technical development.
* Report regularly on project progress, risks, and compliance status to relevant stakeholders.


**Requirements:**
* Minimum of 6 years of experience in technical project management.
* Degree in Engineering or an equivalent technical field.
* Proven experience managing complex projects in technical or regulatory domains.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills across multiple functions and levels
* Fluency in Swedish and English (spoken and written).


 Meritorious Experience:
   

  

* Understanding of the CO₂ structure in OAS System.
* Familiarity with OnePDP and Product Development (PD) processes
* Experience with Type Approval and automotive compliance requirements


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

**Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swati@vipas.se**
 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: IT Procurement Manager
description:
Välkommen till Axfood IT, en av matbranschens största IT-avdelningar med drygt 350 medarbetare. Det är vi som ser till att Axfood, och alla våra kedjor, kan ligga i framkant vad gäller digital utveckling. Vi jobbar med att utveckla och förbättra allt ifrån e-handel till logistiklösningar och AI.
   

  

 Hos Axfood IT blir du del av ett sammanhang som utmanar och levererar lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kollegor och våra kunder. Här finns det alltid möjlighet att lära sig om ny teknik och växa, både som individ och tillsammans med kollegorna.
   

  

**Ditt nya team**
 Vi som jobbar med IT-inköp på Axfood hanterar samtliga upphandlingar, avtalsförlängningar och nya inköp av system och hårdvara till hela Axfoodkoncernen. Vi har valt att placera IT-inköp direkt i vår IT-organisation eftersom vi vet att närheten till våra chefer och team gör processerna bättre och mer effektiva. Idag är vi två seniora inköpare i teamet, men ser fram emot att välkomna en tredje kollega. Som IT Procurement Manager blir du inte bara del av vårt inköpsteam, utan ingår även i avdelningen SIA, som utöver IT-inköp även ansvarar för strategi, arkitektur, säkerhet och innovation här på Axfood.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som IT Procurement Manager spelar du en nyckelroll i Axfoods affärer och bidrar till att vi kan fortsätta utmana med stöd av modern teknik. I rollen leder du upphandlingar och omförhandlingar och samverkar med interna intressenter för att säkerställa att våra inköpsprocesser och avtalsvillkor möter verksamhetens behov och är gynnsamma, säkra och bidrar till ett starkare Axfood. Dina inköp omfattar allt från IT-tjänster och SaaS-lösningar till konsulttjänster, mjukvaror och produkter. Du kommer att ansvara för specifika inköpskategorier inom IT.
   

  

 I rollen som IT Procurement Manager arbetar du tillsammans med andra strategisk inköpare och inköpschef för IT avseende strategiska och taktiska inköpsfrågor. Du får stor möjlighet att påverka din roll som strategisk inköpare, samt vara delaktig i diskussioner om hur inköpsfunktionen kan vidareutvecklas. Dessutom ansvarar du för att:
   

  

**Några ord från vår Head of IT Procurement**
*“Jag är stolt över vad vi åstadkommit under mina snart 6 år på Axfood. Vi är starkt bidragande till Axfoods framgångsrika utveckling genom att säkerställa bra IT-affärer för hela koncernen. Nu ser vi fram emot att stärka teamet ytterligare och välkomna en ny kollega som kan hjälpa oss att fortsätta säkra långsiktigt hållbara IT-inköp.”* 
 - Per Hammarberg, Head of IT Procurement
   

  

**Stämmer detta in på dig?**
 I rollen söker vi dig som påbörjat din karriär inom strategiska inköp i en IT-kontext, och har minst något år i ryggen. I rollen ser vi ett stort behov av att du som söker har förståelse för komplexa IT-miljöer och god förmåga att diskutera olika tekniska lösningar med interna och externa parter, vi ser det därför som extra meriterande att du har en teknisk bakgrund, exempelvis genom utbildning eller tidigare arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du som person är analytisk, kommunikativ och har god förmåga att samarbeta med personer och på olika nivåer i en organisation. Vi tror också att du ansvarsfull och driven person, som tar ägarskap över dina processer och initiativ till förbättringar.
   

  

**För att vara aktuell för rollen behöver du:**
* Relevant utbildning från högskola eller universitet (exempelvis inom ekonomi, systemvetenskap eller juridik)
* Erfarenhet av arbeta med inköp och/eller upphandlingar av IT, såsom system och hårdvara.
* Starka kunskaper i både engelska och svenska i tal och skrift. Detta är nödvändigt då du förväntas kunna analysera avtalstexter och föra förhanlingar på båda språk.


**Ansökningsprocessen**
 Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt att söka jobb hos oss. Om du inte har ett CV redo räcker det med att du länkar en väl ifylld LinkedIn-profil. I din ansökan får du svara på de frågor vi behöver svar på i den här delen av processen, och personligt brev är därför inte obligatoriskt.
   

  

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan därför tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vår rekryteringsprocess innehåller tester, intervjuer, bakgrundskontroll och ID-kontroll. Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod, men vi kommer be dig styrka din identitet i processens slutskede.
   

  

 Vid frågor om rekrytering på Axfood, kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se. Läs mer: Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood. Om du har frågor kring tjänsten, kontakta elisabeth.wehlin@axfood.se. Av GDPR-skäl behandlar vi inga ansökningar eller annan personlig information via mail.
   

  

 Lyssna på en podd om att jobba på Axfood IT, på Spotify.

title: Category Manager IT
job_function: Project Management, Purchasing, and Supply Chain
description:
Are you passionate about shaping IT procurement strategies and driving cost-effective solutions across a global organization? ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions is looking for an experienced and strategic Category Manager IT to join our team. In this key role you’ll lead procurement activities with a primary focus on the IT category, while also potentially supporting other strategic indirect categories, collaborate with internal stakeholders, and optimize supplier relationships to drive cost savings and operational excellence across the division. In this role, you'll thrive in a collaborative, innovative culture that empowers you to build a career to be proud of.
   

  

**What You Will Do As Our Category Manager IT**
 As our Category Manager IT, you will take the lead in defining and implementing category strategies for IT procurement, ensuring that we select the best suppliers and maximize cost efficiency. You’ll support stakeholders across divisions with data-driven insights, helping them make informed decisions on supplier selection and cost-saving initiatives. You’ll collaborate with various internal teams to ensure alignment with divisional and organizational goals.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Define and implement IT category strategies to optimize spend, streamline the supplier base, and align procurement efforts with business needs across divisions.
* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to identify, initiate, and execute savings projects while providing consultative support based on facts and data to guide decision-making.
* Negotiate commercial terms with suppliers, ensuring competitive pricing, favorable conditions, and long-term value through strong supplier performance management.
* Develop, implement, and monitor KPIs for the IT category (Spend development, Savings, Cost Avoidance, Payment Terms, Contract Coverage, Code of Conduct, Project Pipeline, etc)
* Develop and improve routines, processes, and best practices for the IT category
* Depending on your previous experience you might also take responsibility for one more category, for instance Professional Services
* Actively contribute to the Indirect Spend team and drive continuous improvement in sourcing activities across the division.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* 8+ years of experience in category management, with at least 5 years focused on IT procurement.
* Proven track record of delivering on procurement KPIs and cost savings in a complex international and decentralized environment.
* Strong experience in managing IT categories, including software licenses, hardware, and other IT-related services.
* Fluency in English (written and spoken).
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.


 The ideal candidate is a proactive, data-driven problem solver with a strategic and consultative approach, passionate about optimizing procurement processes. They thrive in cross-functional, global environments and possess an analytical mindset, with the ability to create and manage KPIs and develop data-driven strategies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary
* Hybrid model of working
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait.**
 We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us.
   

  

 To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let's together create a safer and more open world!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com.
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Solutions Consultant, Stockholm
description:
We are looking for a new Solutions Consulting team member in Stockholm to help accelerate our exciting journey ahead! As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to become a trusted advisor and help world-class marketers gather, analyze, and optimize their data with Funnel.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Your main responsibilities include working as a sales engineer to demonstrate the value of Funnel to prospects and customers. This includes supporting them during their assessment period from a technical standpoint while sharing best practices related to gathering/managing/analyzing marketing data, especially within the context of addressing complex use cases.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with our Account Executives and Customer Success Managers as well as our Product teams to provide input on the evolution of the Funnel product.
   

  

 You will have achieved success when the prospect or customer fully understands how Funnel is foundational to helping them achieve their business goals as well as helping ongoing customers grow their business with Funnel.
   

  

**As a Solutions Consultant You Will**
* Lead technical pre-sales conversations with prospects
* Lead the implementation of Funnel as a first milestone of the Funnel journey
* Work with customers on complex marketing data use cases
* Become an expert in using the Funnel platform
* Provide input to the Product teams to make our solution even better and deliver ever-increasing value to our customers.
* Collaborate with other members of the global Solutions Consulting team on global initiatives.
* You will join the EMEA team with colleagues based in Stockholm, Dublin and London.


 If you'd like to learn more about Corinna, the Manager of the Solutions Consulting team in EMEA, and her views on leadership, check out this blog post.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a solutions-oriented, proactive product and customer evangelist with outstanding communication skills.
   

  

 You are curious, eager to learn, a team player, and seek out opportunities to help others.
   

  

 You thrive in a consultative environment where you feel comfortable being an expert and knowing how to guide, educate, and manage clear expectations of customers.
   

  

 You are detail-oriented and enjoy working with data. Going down the rabbit hole to get a deep understanding of a problem and how to solve it is something that appeals greatly to you!
   

  

**Experience & Skills**
* Around 2-4 years of experience in a solution consulting, implementation or pre-sales engineering role
* Domain knowledge of digital platforms and/or experience in working with data, marketing analytics, or performance marketing reporting
* Experience in and enjoy working in a client-facing role
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, Looker Studio or similar applications
* Fluency in spoken and written English
* Fluency in spoken and written French is a plus


**Who We Are**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting. Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

**Other Information**
 This role is located in our Stockholm office. At Funnel, we highly value in-person collaboration and we have an office-first approach. We work from the office a minimum of four days a week while still allowing plenty of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer months, and holidays.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Head of Operations
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European-owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 At the outset of our journey, we're not just building software; we're laying the groundwork for our technology solutions and how we’ll operate as an engineering team. As we expand, the organisation of our teams and the specialisation into product areas hinge on these formative decisions. Coming on board now means you're not just coding - you're contributing directly to how we set ourselves up for success, how we tackle challenges, and how we define our engineering culture. This isn’t just a job; it's a chance to leave an indelible mark on our technology, teams, culture, and ethos.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Head of Operations with technical expertise to lead and optimise our global operations. As a critical member of our leadership, you will direct operations teams across multiple data centres and regions, ensuring the highest standards of service reliability, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. You and your team will play a key role in establishing and refining operations while driving continuous improvement initiatives. Your role will be essential in managing large-scale incident response and problem resolution, building and leading technical support teams across multiple tiers, and collaborating with engineering teams to enhance products based on operational insights, while also creating our standard operating procedures and business continuity.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Direct global operations teams across multiple data centres and regions.
* Establish and optimize support infrastructure, SLAs, and escalation protocols.
* Develop metrics and KPIs to measure operational performance and customer satisfaction.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service reliability and efficiency.
* Manage large-scale incident response and problem resolution processes.
* Build and lead technical support teams across multiple tiers.
* Collaborate with engineering on product improvements based on operational insights.
* Establish standardized operating procedures and playbooks.
* Lead crisis management during major service disruptions.


**Skills We Value**
* 10+ years of experience in technical operations management, preferably in cloud services.
* Proven leadership experience managing large, distributed technical teams.
* Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure, virtualization, and networking.
* Track record implementing automation and operational efficiency improvements.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with incident management and problem resolution at scale.
* Knowledge of compliance requirements for cloud services.
* MBA or technical degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Experience with data analytics and performance measurement systems.


 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Senior Consultant
description:
*Vill du vara med och driva arbetet inom molntjänster och IT-infrastruktur?
   

  

 På Advania hjälper vi våra kunder att modernisera sina IT-miljöer, optimera leveransen och skapa säkra, skalbara IT-lösningar. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i ett team av experter och vidareutveckla din kompetens i samarbete med andra specialister.*
 Senior Consultant på Advania 🚀
   

  

 Som Senior Consultant hos oss spelar du en central roll i att initiera, implementera och förvalta moderna IT-lösningar som möter kundernas verksamhetsbehov.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**
* Teknisk rådgivning för ett antal kunder med fokus på säkerhet och proaktivitet.
* Design och implementering av tekniska lösningar on-prem och i cloud.
* Drift och utveckling av centrala servermiljöer och managerade tjänster.


**Du ansvarar även för att:**
* Äga och driva mindre förbättringsprojekt för nya och befintliga tjänster mot kund.
* Förbereda, leda och handleda workshops med kund som teknisk rådgivare.


 Rollen är baserad i Solna och du rapporterar till Head of Delivery Teams. Teamet som du ingår i består av ett mindre team på 4-6 personer och är en del av en större grupp med bred specialistkompetens inom exempelvis Nätverk, Windows Server, Klient, Microsoft SQL och Microsoft 365. Du samarbetar nära andra konsulter samt med våra sälj- och projektteam.
   

  

 Vad som gör denna roll unik⭐
   

  

 Det här är en roll för dig som vill arbeta i en teknisk miljö där din expertis inom Microsofts plattformar verkligen kommer till sin rätt. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med avancerade molnprojekt, samarbeta med andra specialister och kontinuerligt fördjupa din specialistkunskap. Här finns stora möjligheter att påverka och driva innovation tillsammans med våra kunder och likasinnade kollegor.
   

  

 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 För att du ska trivas och lyckas hos oss söker vi dig med en bakgrund inom konsultrollen och tydligt affärsfokus. Du arbetar idag som Technical Account Manager eller tekniskt ansvarig och trivs i en roll där teknik och kundfokus möts.
   

  

 Du är ansvarstagande, har ett starkt driv och en entreprenöriell ådra. Du motiveras av att hjälpa kunder att förverkliga sina verksamhetsbehov och att driva tekniken framåt.
   

  

 Hos oss får du arbeta i team där laget går före jaget. Din vardag kommer i stor utsträckning att handla om att lösa problem tillsammans, i en miljö där du använder din specialistkunskap för att skapa verkligt kundvärde.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst 4-5 års erfarenhet av Microsofts infrastruktur, med fokus på servermiljöer och Azure.
* Certifiering inom AZ-104 Azure Administrator Associate eller AZ-800 Administering Windows Server Hybrid Core Infrastructure, alternativt motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av MSP-branschen är meriterande.


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
   

  

 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.

title: Marketing Production Manager, Nordics
description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 300 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.
   

  

 It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue to shape the future of global entertainment. We bring stories to millions of people around the world, every day - and in the role of Marketing Production Manager (Nordics) you’d be at the center of our Marketing team, working closely with internal and external stakeholders to bring our campaigns to life.
   

  

**The Role**
 We’re looking for an experienced Marketing Producer to lead the execution of world-class marketing campaigns in the Nordics. In this role, you’ll work closely with our Title and Social Marketing Managers and take ownership of the end-to-end production process, from brief to delivery. You’ll partner with our creative and media agencies, ensuring that campaigns are delivered on time, on budget, and to a high creative standard. This role sits at the intersection of creativity and operations, so we’re looking for someone who is both detail-oriented and solutions-driven, with a strong interest in the creative process.
   

  

**Responsibilities Include**
* Production Management: Oversee end-to-end production for marketing asset creation, marketing & social shoots - and marketing activations for our Nordic markets. Develop production timelines, allocate resources, and ensure deadlines are met by our production partners.
* Local adaptations: Collaborate and onboard agency partners to adapt global campaign creatives for our Nordic markets.
* Quality Control: Ensure all marketing materials meet technical quality standards and creative integrity. Review and approve final asset deliverables, ensuring they align with brand guidelines and campaign objectives.
* Budget Management: Manage production budgets, ensuring cost-effective production without compromising quality through our agencies / vendors.
* Vendor Management: Source and manage the day-to-day relationships with our external vendors / agency partners - such as media agencies, creative agencies and production houses. Negotiate contracts and ensure vendors live up to our standards.
* Process / operational improvements: Identify and implement improvements to enhance the efficiency of our production processes and workflows together with internal and external stakeholders.
* Risk Management: Identify potential project and production risks and come up with ways to mitigate them. Continuously monitor project and production progress, and be proactive when it comes to addressing issues.
* Innovation and Trends: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and innovations, and find ways to implement these into our work where relevant.


**Requirements**
* 8+ years of experience as a Marketing Production Manager / Project Manager / Marketing Producer / Creative Producer. Fluent in English and at least one of the Nordic languages.
* Proven track record of executing creative productions from brief to final delivery for large 360 campaigns (which include, but are not limited to; online- and offline marketing assets, social marketing, AV & print finishing, localization, and event production).
* A good understanding of the Nordic media-, vendor-, and production landscape and experience working with a diverse set of agencies (social, media, creative, production houses).
* Able to provide clear and actionable creative direction throughout the production process while effectively communicating with multiple creative partners and stakeholders simultaneously.
* Capable of overseeing and managing multiple campaigns at the same time, and effectively prioritizing your time and effort to what’s most pressing.
* The right candidate can identify opportunities to improve our campaigns by having a strong understanding of how different types of media / channels work together to generate positive brand impact.


**Personality Attributes**
* Works collaboratively with others, valuing team success over individual success. Builds strong relationships and fosters a positive and open team environment.
* Anticipates needs and challenges, taking initiative to address them before they become issues.
* Demonstrates a strong sense of ownership and responsibility.
* Strong operational skills and attention to detail, ensuring all aspects of projects are managed effectively.
* Flexible to change and able to pivot as needed. Working to find quick and constructive solutions when challenges arise.
* Continuously seeks to learn new things and improve. Embraces opportunities for professional growth and development.
* A strong passion for entertainment - and specifically film/series - is a big plus!


 Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.
   

  

 We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

title: Senior Business Advisor, Group Internal Audit | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you ready to make an impact? SEB is looking for a driven and forward-thinking Senior Business Advisor to join Group Internal Audit – a strategic role where you will work closely with senior management and help shape the future of our global audit function.
   

  

 Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we'll help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. Welcome to SEB.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Group Internal Audit (GIA) is an independent unit that reports directly to SEB’s Board of Directors via the Audit and Compliance Committee. The purpose of the function is to evaluate and give assurance to the Board and the President of SEB that governance, risk management and internal control processes as designed and represented by management are adequate and effective and support the business objectives. The department consists of around ninety professionals that utilises a common global methodology and automated audit tools. This new role within the Group department is designed to meet the emerging requirements of a forward-looking and proactive audit function to help ensure that it remains relevant within SEB.
   

  

 The person undertaking the Senior Business Advisor role will be responsible for supporting the Head of GIA in the coordination and delivery of the quarterly and annual Group Internal Audit reports to its stakeholders in the Executive Management and Board of SEB. This will include coordination of the Annual Risk Assessment process together and preparing the material to be presented to the Board on the results of the Risk Assessment and development of the annual Audit Plan. Also, for driving the strategic development of resources within the global Audit function, as decided by the Head of GIA, with regards to budget and financial control.
   

  

 An essential element of the job will include overseeing the training and competence development of the GIA staff to meet the demands of the global Audit activities, but you will also be able to hold training on your own or together with colleagues in the team.
   

  

 The role will involve coordinating the maintenance and enhancement of the Audit Tool that supports the work of the global Audit team, together with the existing teams working with the Audit Tool. The Senior Business Advisor will also be in regular contact with the SEB External Auditor, currently EY, and deal with upcoming matters. Additionally support the Head of GIA in the contact with supervisors and having a coordinating role when gathering information to different requests coming in from FSA, mainly in Sweden but could also come in other locations. A key attribute of the job will include close cooperation with the GIA management team members that will support the Senior Business Advisor in the delivery of the various tasks.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Strong leadership and project management skills.
* A deep understanding of the operations of a global Audit department within a leading Financial Services company.
* A hands-on mindset and strong self-motivation – you take initiative and get things done.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively in a large team environment.
* A strategic mindset and the ability to act in the best interest of SEB as part of the GIA management team.
* A broad background in the Financial Services industry.
* At least 5 years of experience working as an internal or external auditor.
* A relevant and recognized audit certification (e.g., CFA, CISA, CPA, or CIA) – considered an advantage.
* Strong proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
* An openness to and interest in new technologies, such as AI and Copilot.


**What Do We Offer**
 This position will provide you with an opportunity to enhance your existing knowledge and skills in relation to directly supporting the Head of GIA in managing the Group Audit function at SEB. You will get the chance to further develop your knowledge and experience of the workings of a Global Audit function. Also to be engaged directly in helping the whole GIA management team with driving change in the audit department to meet the enhanced demands in a dynamic business and regulatory environment.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to SEB. Since we select candidates on an ongoing basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than
 **25th of June 2025** 
 . If you have questions about the job, you can contact me Björn Rosenkvist by mail at bjorn.rosenkvist@seb.se.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Head of Delivery
description:
*Hos oss hittar du ett gäng med hjärta för både teknik och affär – och nu behöver vårt team i Stockholm en ledare som vill ta ansvar för allt från trivsel och utveckling till leverans och struktur. Vi är specialiserade på NetSuite – ett molnbaserat affärssystem – och hjälper några av Nordens mest spännande tillväxtbolag att växa ännu smartare genom att optimera finansiell styrning, operativ effektivitet och datadrivet beslutsfattande.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Här blir du en nyckelperson i vår fortsatta utvecklingsresa – med fullt personalansvar för ett team på 14 personer med olika erfarenhetsnivåer. Våra inhouse-konsulter arbetar nära kunder inom främst tech, SaaS och e-handel, där vi skapar skräddarsydda lösningar med verklig affärsnytta. I rollen driver du utvecklingen av både individer och team. Du bygger en kultur präglad av nytänkande och välmående – där idéer får ta plats och människor får växa. Ditt ledarskap är både coachande och visionärt: du inspirerar, utmanar och visar vägen framåt.
 



 Du har koll på beläggning, trivsel och leverans – men också på nästa steg. Du äger det operativa resultatet för teamet, allokerar resurser smart och arbetar proaktivt med att lyfta både kapacitet och kompetens. Du blir också en viktig del av ledningsgruppen, där du representerar både teamet och Stockholmskontoret i stort.
 



  





**Urval av arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Leder, coachar och utvecklar både teamet som helhet och varje individ utifrån deras behov
* Säkerställer smart resursfördelning – rätt person på rätt plats, vid rätt tillfälle
* Följer upp beläggning, kostnader och teamets leverans med fokus på balans och resultat
* Delaktig i rekryteringar, introducerar och vägleder nya medarbetare med en tydlig plan för framgång
* Bidrar aktivt till bolagets riktning och utveckling genom ditt arbete i ledningsgruppen



  





**Vi söker dig som är..** 




 En närvarande ledare som trivs med att vara mitt i verksamheten, bygga relationer och driva teamet framåt med tydlighet, struktur och engagemang. Du har en nyfikenhet på nya arbetssätt, vågar utmana det invanda och ser möjligheter till förbättring i vardagen. Samtidigt har du alltid helheten i sikte: du förstår kopplingen mellan välmående, prestation och affär, samt arbetar proaktivt för att teamet ska bidra till både kundvärde och lönsamhet.
 



 Du tänker långsiktigt, är van vid att ta ansvar för resultat och har ett strategiskt öga för vad som krävs för att verksamheten ska utvecklas i takt med omvärlden. Som ledare vet du vikten av att vara lyhörd och coachande, och har en naturlig förmåga att skapa förtroende – både i teamet och i ledningsgruppen. Och ja – du är också en person som bidrar till att jobbet inte bara blir gjort, utan också blir roligt på vägen.
 



  





**Om önskemålen** 
 :
 


* Ca 3-5 års erfarenhet av att leda team med goda resultat
* Erfarenhet av ERP och IT-konsultbranschen (inhouse-konsulter)
* Tidigare erfarenhet av budgetansvar och ledningsgruppsarbete
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, ekonomi eller annat relevant område
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Om oss** 




 Hos oss på
 **Noresca** 
 får du stort eget ansvar, engagerade kollegor och möjligheten att vara en del av ett stabilt, växande Gasellbolag med hjärtat på rätt ställe. Vi grundades 2017 och är idag 34 personer fördelade mellan våra kontor i Stockholm och Göteborg.
