Med fokus på både kundnöjdhet och medarbetartrivsel har vi byggt en kultur där människor trivs och stannar – något vi är extra stolta över att våra medarbetarundersökningar och kundomdömen bekräftar.
 



 Vi gillar att ha roligt tillsammans och arrangerar regelbundet sociala aktiviteter – från frukostar och AW:s till konferensresor i Sverige och utomlands. Vi värdesätter balans mellan jobb och privatliv, och erbjuder en flexibel arbetsmiljö där du får vara med och påverka – på riktigt.
 



  





**START** 
 : Enligt överenskommelse
 



**PLATS** 
 : Stockholm, Convendum Drottninggatan
 



**OMFATTNING** 
 : Heltid
 



**LÖN** 
 : Fast lön
 



**KONTAKT** 
 : Senior Talent Manager, mikaela.ehk@oddwork.se (för frågor om tjänsten, ej ansökningar)
 



**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM** 
 : Urval sker löpande
 



  





 This recruitment process is powered by Teamtailor on behalf of Oddwork. By applying for this role, you confirm that we store your personal data to be able to process the job application. Follow the link to read the Privacy Policy and learn more about what type of personal information we collect and how we use and protect such information: jobb.oddwork.se/pages/teamtailor-gdpr

title: Group Business Analyst
description:
Do you want to be part of shaping future data-driven decisions in a fast-paced and ambitious organization? Then we are looking for you - join our team!
 



  





 Do you want to be part of shaping future data-driven decisions in a fast-paced and ambitious organization? Then we are looking for you, if you are also someone who combines technical acumen with business thinking to create real value. As a
 **Group Business Analyst** 
 within our company, you will have a central role in transforming data into insights and insights into action. You will be a key player in our journey towards even smarter decisions, both strategically and operationally, across all our markets.
 



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive compensation and benefits: We offer an attractive fixed salary that reflects your skills and experience. You’ll also receive a comprehensive benefits package, including generous wellness allowances, occupational pension, and health insurance.
* Be part of something bigger: We believe in building a strong sense of community and engagement, where everyone contributes to the company’s success. That’s why we offer you the opportunity to become a shareholder.
* Freedom with responsibility: We believe in giving our people the freedom to plan their work so that it works in everyday life. At the same time, we know that the best way to build our culture, develop and learn from each other is when we come together.



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Collaborate closely with executive teams, business and process developers, and IT functions to understand needs, identify opportunities, and transform data into actionable insights.
* Map and document business flows and processes to identify the right data sources and create relevant analyses.
* Develop reports and visualizations that make complex information easy to act on from a business perspective.
* Initiate and lead experimental approaches to improve our internal tools and processes. This may include A/B testing, multivariate testing, pre-post analyses, or other methods for causal inference.
* You play a key role in strengthening the organization’s ability to understand and use data in everyday work. Your efforts contribute to increasing our overall data literacy.



  





**Your Profile** 



* Have experience working with data in a business-oriented context, such as business intelligence, business controlling, as a business analyst, or similar roles.
* Moves effortlessly in the cross-section between technology and business and thrives on taking initiative.
* Have knowledge of SQL and are comfortable working in cloud-based environments such as AWS or GCP – ideally with experience using tools like BigQuery.
* Is curious about new technology and has experience building own AI agents or working with generative AI.
* Communicates effortlessly in English; knowledge of the Swedish language is a strong merit.



  





**To succeed in this** 
 role, you are:
 


* Goal-oriented
* Organised
* Responsible
* Change-oriented



  





**Recruitment Process** 



* Logic and personality tests
* Phone interview with Talent Acquisition
* Digital interview with Talent Acquisition
* Final interview including business case with the hiring manager



  





**About us** 




 As an international company, we are leaders in staffing and recruitment of individuals at the start of their careers. You can find us in Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, Germany, and Switzerland.
 



  





 Why choose us? We consciously invest in digital innovation and smart working methods to stay at the forefront of our industry. Here you not only get the opportunity to influence – you get to be part of leading the way. Furthermore, we see it as our mission to help people grow, whether you are at the beginning of your career or an experienced professional looking for your next challenge. We also have an unbeatable company culture where we challenge, inspire, and support each other so that we can grow together. You can read more about what we offer on our career site.
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Working hours:** 
 Fulltime, 40h/week
 



**Start:** 
 As soon as possible

title: Enterprisearkitekt
description:
Trivs du i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och teknik? Uppskattar du möjligheten till att få agera rådgivare och träffa många olika kunder och verksamheter? Då kan det här vara drömtjänsten för dig! Atea har en unik kundbas och har stor efterfrågan på dessa rådgivande tjänster och därför söker vi dig som vill jobba som Enterprisearkitekt hos oss i Stockholm.
 



  





 Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa både professionellt och som människa. Vi värdesätter dina unika styrkor och erfarenheter, och tillsammans gör vi skillnad varje dag. Tillsammans bygger vi Sverige med it.
 



  





**Din roll** 




 I rollen som Enterprisearkitekt harmoniserar du IT med organisationens affärsstrategi. Du säkerställer att IT-stödet är förberett för framtida förändringar och realiseras effektivt och hållbart. Du kommer att agera rådgivare åt våra kunder och möjliggöra deras digitala förflyttning. Du leder workshops, utredningar och intervjuer för att fånga behov och omsätta dem i konkreta förändringsförslag som ligger i linje med uppsatt vision och mål. Dina kontaktytor hos kund är främst beslutsfattare och ledningsfunktioner. Du får möjligheten att arbeta med vår breda kundbas och där uppdragets längd, omfattning och komplexitet varierar.
 



  





 I rollen kommer du att samarbeta med dina kollegor i Stockholm, andra resurser inom Atea och inte minst med övriga IT-arkitekter runtom i landet. Det finns ett stort mått av frihet i rollen, där du styr din tid på det sätt du anser bäst för att nå dina, Ateas och kundens mål.
 



  





**Sammanfattning av huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter i rollen:** 



* Beskriva kopplingen mellan strategi, affärsprocesser, IT-infrastruktur och integrationermellan olika system
* Delta eller driva arkitektkontor hos kund
* Säkerställa att det finns arkitektoniska förutsättningar för att lyckas med den digitala transformationen hos kunden
* Arbeta nära kundens ledning för att analysera, utveckla och effektivisera affärsstrategier med stöd av digital teknik, som är i linje med kundens målbild
* Ha en aktiv roll för att säkerställa helhet och förvaltningsbarhet
* Tillsammans med Ateas samlade kompetens, översätta kundens behov till planer, strategier och arkitektur som leder till effektiva och innovativa lösningar
* Genomföra utredningar, workshops och driva förändringsprojekt tillsammans med våra projektledare och konsulter inom andra kompetensområden



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper, som är viktiga för att lyckas och trivas i rollen. Du har en god strategisk förmåga och kan tänka brett och ur ett helhetsperspektiv för att hjälpa våra kunder på bästa sätt. Du ser även sakers långsiktiga betydelser och konsekvenser av beslut. Du är van vid att leda och har en god kommunikativ förmåga i både tal och skrift och du känner dig trygg och tala och argumentera för din sak. Du talar pedagogiskt, välformulerat och engagerat i workshops/presentationer till kunder samt har en god förmåga att ”fånga rummet”. Du arbetar strukturerat och vet när du behöver prioritera. Har förmågan att lägga in en extra växel när det behövs för att nå uppsatta mål och deadlines. Slutligen är du så pass trygg och erfaren i din roll att du kan ta egna initiativ, fatta beslut och får saker att hända för att uppnå önskade resultat.
 



  





**För rollen som Enterprisearkitekt ser vi att du har:** 



* Relevant erfarenhet av it-branschen
* Flertalet års erfarenhet från roller inom arkitektur, verksamhetsutveckling och digitalisering eller exempelvis projektledare, förändringsledare, förvaltningsledare, processledare, it-ansvarig etc.
* Tidigare arbetat som konsult eller i uppdrag inom olika branscher och verksamheter
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Etablerat IT-strategier och arbetat systematiskt med målarkitekturarbete
* Erfarenhet av uppdrag för både offentlig- och privat sektor
* Analys och målbildsarbete
* DF Kompetens Certifierad it-arkitekt Master eller motsvarande
* CITA-P - Internationellt certifierad it-arkitekt
* Arkitekturmodeller, t ex TOGAF, COBIT
* ITIL
* PM3
* Projektmodeller
* Relevant akademisk examen, eller motsvarande



  





**Om Atea** 




 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
 



  





 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" - en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
 



  





**Kontakt & mer information** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Marcus Aleson, Konsultchef, via marcus.aleson@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 



 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!** 




**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Customer Support & Expansion Project Lead
description:
**Customer Support & Expansion Project Lead – Tule rakentamaan Greenelyn menestystä Suomessa! 🇫🇮🌱**
 Etsimme nyt kaksikielistä osaajaa, joka yhdistää erinomaisen asiakaspalveluosaamisen kykyyn johtaa projekteja ja kehittää prosesseja. Greenely lanseeraa palvelunsa Suomessa ja tarvitsemme sinut avainrooliin rakentamaan parasta asiakaskokemusta ja tukemaan kasvuamme Suomen markkinoilla. Rooli sijaitsee Tukholmassa, Ruotsissa.
   

  

 Roolista
   

  

 Haluatko olla tärkeä osa innovatiivista ja nopeasti kasvavaa yritystä, joka vie kestävää energiankäyttöä eteenpäin? Tässä roolissa yhdistyvät asiakaspalvelu, projektivastuu ja prosessien kehittäminen – olet sekä asiakkaiden ensilinja että strateginen rakentaja Suomen lanseerauksessa.
   

  

 Työskentelet tiiviisti eri tiimien kanssa – asiakaspalvelu, tuote, markkinointi ja operatiivinen johto – varmistaaksesi, että Greenelyn palvelu toimii sujuvasti suomalaisille asiakkaille. Sinulla on mahdollisuus vaikuttaa asiakaskokemukseen, kehittää toimintatapoja ja johtaa kehitysprojekteja, jotka tukevat markkinalanseerausta ja kasvua.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
* Vara Greenelys ambassadör i kommunikationen med våra finska kunder via chatt, mejl och telefon.
* Hjälpa kunder med frågor kopplade till elavtal, elförbrukning och användning av appen.
* Leda och driva projekt relaterade till vår etablering och tillväxt i Finland, särskilt inom kundupplevelse och operativt stöd.
* Implementera och förbättra processer och rutiner för kundsupport med fokus på skalbarhet och kvalitet.
* Samarbeta med interna team såsom produkt, marknad och tech för att säkerställa ett starkt lokalt erbjudande.
* Identifiera och rapportera buggar och förbättringsmöjligheter i appen till produktteamet.
* Skapa och uppdatera FAQ-artiklar, kundinstruktioner och interna riktlinjer.
* Bidra till kontinuerlig utveckling av kundresan och kundupplevelsen i den finska marknaden.


**Din Profil**
 Vi tror att du har ett genuint intresse för människor, teknik och kundservice. Du är positiv, lyhörd och lösningsorienterad, med en naturlig förmåga att ge våra kunder en fantastisk upplevelse.
   

  

* Du har erfarenhet av kundsupport, projektledning eller att arbeta med processutveckling – gärna i en snabbväxande eller digital miljö.
* Du är flytande i finska, svenska och engelska – både i tal och skrift.
* Du har ett starkt servicefokus och en naturlig förmåga att skapa goda kundupplevelser.
* Du är självgående, strukturerad och har lätt för att ta initiativ.
* Du trivs i en roll med en blandning av varierande och repetitiva arbetsuppgifter och är inte rädd för att kavla upp ärmarna när det behövs.
* Du har god teknisk förståelse och ett intresse för digitala lösningar.
* Erfarenhet från energibranschen är meriterande men inte ett krav.


**För Att Lyckas Hos Oss**
* Du har en stark känsla för service och trivs med varierande arbetsuppgifter.
* Du gillar att samarbeta, ta initiativ och aktivt bidra till förbättring.
* Du drivs av nyfikenhet och vill lära dig mer om energi- och hållbarhetsfrågor


**Startdatum:** 
 asap
   

  

**Vi kan erbjuda dig 🏢👩‍💻**
* Innovation och hållbarhet: Du får vara med och bidra till framtidens energilösningar och vara en del av vårt snabbväxande företag i en innovativ miljö.
* Utvecklingsmöjligheter: Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas både tekniskt och professionellt i en spännande och dynamisk arbetsmiljö.
* Bidra till något meningsfullt: Genom att jobba hos oss får du vara en del av vårt uppdrag att göra energi mer hållbar och tillgänglig för framtiden.
* Förmåner: 5000 kronor i friskvårdsbidrag, friskvårdstimme på arbetstid, tjänstepension, privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, konkurrenskraftig lön och mycket mer!


**Om Greenely**
 Greenely är en digitalt energibolag som hjälper människor att sänka sina elkostnader genom att optimera deras elanvändning med smart teknik i en app. För närvarande använder över 145 000 hushåll Greenely i Sverige.
   

  

 Greenely, med stöd av nordiska riskkapitalbolag, har som uppdrag att göra det möjligt för hushåll över hela världen att kontrollera och optimera sitt hems och bils elanvändning, samtidigt som Greenely optimerar utbud och efterfrågan av el och på så sätt skapar hållbara energisamhällen världen över.
   

  

 WE ARE
 **bold and push the limit.**
 WE BELIEVE THAT
 **f** 
****ast is better than slow.****
 WE
 **t** 
******hink like owners.******
 WE
 ****lead with knowledge.****
 Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer by using technology. We are a digital energy provider that helps people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing the home and car's electricity usage with smart technology in an app.
   

  

 Greenely, with the support of Nordic venture capital companies, has a mission to make it possible for households all over the world to connect, control and optimize their energy usage. We ultimately believe that the best electricity is the one that is not used at all, both for the wallet and the planet!

title: Lead Auditor - Information Security ISO 27001
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a result of further growth of our Business Assurance Unit in Sweden we are looking for qualified
 **Lead Auditors** 
 within the
 **Information Security ISO 27001** 
 area, preferably combined with ISO 9001.
   

  

**Your place of employment can be anywhere in Sweden, with visits to the client site.**
 As a
 **Lead Auditor** 
 you will be part of our team of auditors. Your assignments will be performing audits according to standards for information security – normally at the customer’s premises - in a wide variety of industries.
   

  

 You will be part of a professional team of colleagues with experience in many industries. As a Lead Auditor you will work both independently and in multidisciplinary teams.
   

  

**The Assignment May Include**
* Performing audits for Swedish and international clients
* Project management of larger certification projects
* Development of new services, training services, etc. on an ad hoc basis
* Supporting sales team and contributing to sales revenue.


 What we offer
   

  

 In DNV we are proud to lead the development in our main industries. Whether we work with some of the world’s leading companies to help solve some of their risk or safety challenges or we initiate joint industry projects to solve an industry-wide technical issue, we always aim to deliver expert insight and value to our customers and stakeholders. You will work with experts from a wide range of disciplines and build your competence, problem-solving abilities. It will broaden your view.
   

  

**We offer**
* A strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* Attractive total compensation package
* International working environment
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance
* Interesting and challenging customers and projects, both national and international
* Be part of a world-leading company that has a global reach with more than 12 000 employees around to world and is headquartered in Norway.
* The possibility to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV.


**Requirements**
 About you
   

  

* Relevant educational background
* At least four years full-time practical work experience in information technology, of which at least two years in a role or function relating to information security
* Experience with one or more of the following standards: ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 and knowledge of best practices regarding information security.
* ISO 22301 - Business continuity and ISO 20000 - Service Management is not a requirement but is an advantage.
* Good communication and collaborative skills
* Must be able to travel, including overnight stays, often involving travel outside of normal working hours
* Good English skills in speech and writing, as well as fluent in Swedish, both in speech and writing
* Great commercial and sales skills preferred
* Strong communication and training skills preferred.


**Personal qualities**
* Are organized, service-minded, and focused on timely delivery with the right quality
* Are both a team player as well as self-reliant
* Like working in an international organization
* Are business- and customer-oriented
* Good communication and commercial skills, able to choose appropriate methods and style to suit the situation and audience.


 For more details about this role please contact: Patrik Flink, Operations Manager, Sweden at +46 708 301 683
   

  

 Please submit your CV in English or Swedish.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Please be informed you may be requested to provide DNV with additional documents for a background check.

title: Team Manager - Promote
description:
Let's shape the future of recruitment together!
   

  

 Teamtailor is an Employer Branding and an ATS SaaS platform used by over 10,000 companies, with 200,000 users in 90 countries worldwide 🌏.
   

  

 Working at Teamtailor means being a part of a dynamic, international, and fast-paced tech company that provides an ideal environment for those who aspire to make a real impact on an organization's growth and eagerly embrace responsibilities. It's also about having a lot of fun 🥳.
   

  

 Building a diverse team with a range of backgrounds and expertise has been at the heart of Teamtailor since its inception and continues to be our strength today. There are no typical profiles - every team member shares our vision and wants to contribute to our success.
   

  

 Team Manager - Promote
   

  

 Are you someone who thrives at the intersection of leadership, digital marketing, and customer experience? We're on the lookout for a people-first leader with a strong background in digital media and/or the recruitment industry who’s ready to take charge of our Promote team and help take our customers' success to the next level.
   

  

 As the Team Manager, you’ll make sure the team runs smoothly day-to-day, while also coaching and supporting team members to hit their goals and grow in their roles. You’ll play a key part in strengthening both our customer relationships and how we operate.
   

  

 Our mission? To create happy users and always aim to wow them. That’s why we’re looking for someone with a true passion for leading teams, creating impact, and delivering world-class experience 👊🏽
   

  

**So, what does the Promote team do?**
 We help our users and customers build smart, effective recruitment and employer branding campaigns. We support them in strategy, build trust and relationships, develop media plans, create and optimize campaigns, craft great content, and analyze results. It’s a mix of creativity, data, and human connection.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Be To**
* Oversee day-to-day operations to ensure tasks run smoothly and internal processes are followed
* Drive the team toward individual and collective goals, contributing to department-wide success
* Track and follow up on KPIs for both the team and individuals
* Coach and support team members to help them grow and perform at their best
* Assist with customer cases, internal requests, and working methods
* Lead the Promote team across Sales, Customer Care, Ad Ops, and Content
* Identify and drive improvements in team performance and development
* Report key insights, KPIs, and updates to the Head of Customer Success
* Take an active, hands-on role in sales activities and ad operations
* Ensure smooth and strong collaboration with other departments
* Contribute to and lead projects for the development of our ads, customer relationships, service offering, and overall strategy


 We believe that you...
   

  

* Have at least 2-3 years of Digital Media experience, plus, from both Sales and Ad ops 🤙
* Plus, with a background in HR/Recruitment 🚀
* Proven experience in leading team/s. 🙏
* Good communication and listening skills 🗣️
* Strong adaptability to changes in a fast-paced environment 💨
* Engaged, creative, and solution-oriented mindset 🤩
* Willingness to learn and explore new ideas 🧠🌪️
* Analytical, tech-savvy, and data-driven 👩‍💻👨🏽‍💻
* Speak and write English fluently 🇬🇧
* Up for some post-work fun with your colleagues? Fantastic! We're all about themed after-hours hangouts! 🪩
* Having good social skills and a passion for helping clients is a must 😊


**What We Offer You**
* Challenge yourself in a dynamic and rewarding leadership role
* Gain experience leading a high-performing team in a fast-growing SaaS company
* Contribute to the success of Teamtailor’s Customer Success department while working on your professional growth
* Incredible development and growth opportunities
* A fixed salary with a commission structure
* A lot of personal responsibility
* The opportunity to work with the market's best product
* Yearly company retreat in the sun!
* A great team that always supports and helps each other


 If this sounds like you, then you know what to do. 😉

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator
description:
Ready to gain hands-on TA experience while studying HR? Join us as our new part-time Talent Acquisition Coordinator and collaborate with a skilled, supportive team!
   

  

**About The Role**
 Be part of the journey taking recruiting, employer branding and onboarding to the next level in If, where we strive to create a positive and inspiring candidate experience.
   

  

 You’ll contribute ensuring having a high-quality candidate experience by offering day-to-day support in candidate communication and coordinating recruitment processes with colleagues in HR and recruiting leaders, both locally and Nordic. You will mainly be involved in recruitments of profiles within IT/Tech, but you will also contribute to recruiting other type of roles that are to be found within If.
   

  

 You might also have a role in our employer branding activities, by for example booking and planning student events, as well as contributing to development work of our recruitment processes and templates. We appreciate the insight and ideas you can bring us, as well as your contribution in the daily work.
   

  

**We offer**
 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as a highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of a hybrid workplace
* A health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Lunch benefit


**About The Team**
 This role is part of the Tech & Specialist TA team, reporting to the Team Lead for Tech & Specialist TA. You will join a welcoming, skilled, and inclusive team that supports and motivates each other in daily work. The team consists of seven TA Partners across the Nordics and Baltics, as well as two other part-time coordinators. You will also be part of the larger TA organization, comprising over 20 dedicated TA professionals.
   

  

 In addition to working closely with your HR colleagues, you will have daily interactions with hiring leaders, as well as key stakeholders from the business. who will support you in succeeding and growing in your role. As a key business partner, you will have the opportunity to make a real impact in the organization.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You have an ambition to learn more in the area of recruitment and employer branding. Your inner drive is strong, and you have a sense of responsibility and can be trusted to deliver. You are structured and able to manage multiple tasks at the same time. It is easy for you to create internal and external relations.
   

  

**You also have:**
* Started a bachelor’s or master’s degree, it’s an advantage if you are in the beginning of your studies
* Some work experience within e.g. HR, communication, event planning, coordination, marketing etc. would be beneficial
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English, both verbal and written. Any other Nordic language skill is a bonus.


**Additional facts and the recruitment process:**
**Application deadline:** 
 June 22, 2025. However, screening and interviewing will begin immediately.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV. Please attach your CV. A cover letter is not required—instead, we ask you to answer a few short questions as part of the application process.
   

**Work location:** 
 Bergshamra
   

  

**Start:** 
 August/September 2024
   

  

**Schedule:** 
 16-20 hours a week. You get the opportunity to distribute the hours over the week between Mon-Fri, 8am-5pm, in dialogue with the business
   

  

 Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. If you have further questions about the position or the process, you are welcome to contact Joanna Bonn Rosén, Team Lead Tech & Specialist TA, joanna.bonn.rosen@if.se
   

  

 Final candidates will undergo a background check before employment.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Commercial Advisor
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Commercial Advisor 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Assignment Description**
 For our client we are looking for 4 Commercial Advisor/Commercial Specialist/Program Manager.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Commercial Advisor you will provide commercial expertise. In order to deliver expected business value throughout the product life cycle. Commercial Advisors support by bringing rigor to business cases, executing deals that achieve business objectives, and identifying ways to optimize ongoing relationships with external partners.
   

  

 The Commercial Advisor has great leadership skills, believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust. Working with a focus on value creation, growth and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Delivering exceptional customer and business results.
   

  

**You will be responsible to:**
* Manage complex procurement initiatives
* Negotiate with external partners to secure advantageous terms
* Screening of potential new partners and collaborations relevant for the product area
* Working with product leaders to define and secure the business case
* Establish relevant type of commercial model/cooperation most likely to serve the business case
* Define and implement strategic parameters for the partner portfolio and ensure its optimal long-term management
* Perform risk management for partner and vendor contracts and agreements
* Challenge existing commercial models setups and suggest new commercial/contractual strategies
* Manage deal making processes required such as RFP, tendering crafting, time planning etc.
* Continuously acquire knowledge of the product domain/area through supplier and market analyses
* Monitor and act on spend analyses
* Support set up for collaboration and governance between product stakeholders, partners and vendors


**Qualifications**
**We believe you have:**
* Program/project manager skills
* Great analytical skills (KPI's, business case construction), Problem-solving capabilities and pragmatic outlook
* Strategic thinker who can connect the objectives of a business case to the actions needed to execute
* Negotiation and conflict-resolution skills and ability to influence and persuade others
* Solid communication skills, including being able to provide challenges in a constructive manner
* Ability to set plans and to bring others along – cross-functional or interdisciplinary background a plus
* Results-oriented, concrete, pragmatic, efficient and Proactive questioner
* Deal-making experience and understanding of a wide variety of deal structures


**Required Skills**
* Program Management
* project management
* Analytical Skills


**Languages**
* Swedish (Proficient)
* English (Proficient)


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at shrini@vipas.se
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Business Controller to Sweco IT
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Architecture and Planning, and Environmental Services
description:
Working at Sweco IT and as a Business Controller means working in an innovative and dynamic company that is constantly changing and developing. You get the opportunity to be part of a competent and passionate team that supports and challenge each other to move forward. Learning from each other and having fun at work is important to us and we act in line with our core behaviors; approachable, committed and with recognized expertise to match.
   

  

 We are now seeking an innovative and committed Business controller to play a vital role to deliver cost-efficient operation and improved finance performance.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will be part of a controller group that is responsible for the financial follow-up for Sweco’s entire IT cost. The IT organization consists of about 315 employees, including 30 managers with whom you will have a lot of contact. In addition to traditional controller tasks, you will also be involved in various business cases and various changes that may arise in connection with the continuous procurements and acquisitions made by Sweco. Your main tasks will include
   

  

* Quality assurance, follow-up and budgeting of IT costs
* Assist the IT managers with reporting, analyses and follow-up against budget and forecasts monthly
* Assist the CIO and IT leadership-team with strategic work
* Financial follow-up of internal IT projects
* Transfer pricing and allocation of IT costs within the Group
* Work with suppliers, licenses and agreements linked to these
* Work with investment calculations and pricing models
* Continuous improvement and development work for increased efficiency and clarity


 The role is located at our office in Stockholm and with possibilities to hybrid work setup.
   

  

**We believe that you have**
* Experience in understanding business control, financial planning and analysis
* A couple of years’ experience as business controller or similar positions, preferable within an IT organization
* Strong written and verbal skills in English
* Experience with BI tools such as Power BI is highly valued
* Relevant University education in economics or equivalent


 To succeed as a business controller, we also believe that being social and communicative is a key to success. You enjoy collaboration with others and have a strong sense of organizing and structuring your own work as well as the work of others. In addition, you are able to challenge and drive performance in a constructive manner whilst having a pedagogic mindset with ability to tailor message to the audience.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* You would join an including, dynamic, fast-growing and friendly environment with great expertise and passion for what we do
* We offer a hybrid remote solution as well as flexible working hours
* Great opportunities to grow within the role and at Sweco IT as a company
* Strong compensation package


**Are you interested?**
 If you want to know more about the position or Sweco as a workplace, please contact Sarah Tallmark, CFO Sweco IT, at sarah.tallmark@sweco.se. Use the link to send your application and CV today or no later than July 15. We do not accept applications by mail.
   

  

 At Sweco, we strive to be a workplace characterized by diversity. We believe that more perspectives broaden our ability to continue to achieve our goals and are committed to create an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

 Welcome with your application!
   

  

*Sweco plans and designs the sustainable communities and cities of the future. Together with our clients and the collective knowledge of our 22,000 architects, engineers and other experts, we co-create solutions to address urbanization, capture the power of digitalization, and make our societies more sustainable. Sweco is Europe’s leading engineering and architecture consultancy, with sales of approximately SEK 29 billion (EUR 2.5 billion) in 2023. The company is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. www.swecogroup.com*

title: Client Director
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
 You will produce new business with a defined set of ServiceNow's largest existing accounts. You will oversee executive relationship management for assigned accounts and lead virtual teams, including Solution Sales, Solution Consulting, Support and Professional Services, in supporting our most esteemed clients.
   

  

**What You Get To Do In This Role**
* Provide strategic leadership to clients
* Be the relationship manager between customers and ServiceNow
* Work with the greater ServiceNow solution teams to develop a ServiceNow solution based on the customer's strategic outcomes
* Manage all Executive relationships between ServiceNow and assigned clients
* Oversee worldwide development of assigned accounts, including development and deployment of worldwide resources
* Build trust and deep multi-tiered relationships through assigned clients' organization, from project/IT teams to CxO level
* Develop a clear roadmap and building capabilities across our clients and ServiceNow teams to promote an outstanding customer experience
* Achieve financial targets set out for the assigned clients, including Licenses, Renewals and Professional Services


**Qualifications**
**To be successful in this role you have:**
* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* 7+ years of experience in client management, and aligning account strategies to revenue opportunities
* 2+ years of experience as a Client Director or equivalent role with validated multi-million-dollar sales solutions experience and Executive level relationship management
* Previous sales experience in IT Service Management, HR, Security Operations, Customer Service and IT Operations Management (within software or IT sales organizations)
* Experience achieving sales targets
* Experience leading virtual or matrixed teams
* Ability to understand broad, macro-level business IT needs for a prospective client
* Travel up to 50% (depending on geography/region)
* Native Swedish


 FD21
   

  

*Not sure if you meet every qualification? We still encourage you to apply! We value inclusivity, welcoming candidates from diverse backgrounds, including non-traditional paths. Unique experiences enrich our team, and the willingness to dream big makes you an exceptional candidate!*
 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2024 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: Affärsanalytiker till Försvarsmakten (business analyst)
description:
Vill du utvecklas professionellt och personligt samtidigt som du gör skillnad för Sveriges försvar? Försvarsmakten söker nu en driven affärsanalytiker till vårt högkvarter i Stockholm. Här får du en unik möjlighet att bidra till att stärka Försvarsmaktens försörjningsförmåga genom att analysera och identifiera risker i våra kommersiella försörjningskedjor.
   

  

**Om enheten**
 Du kommer att arbeta på den kommersiella avdelningen i Försvarsmaktens högkvarter. Vår uppgift är att stödja, inrikta, leda och följa upp den kommersiella verksamheten i Försvarsmakten i alla beredskapsnivåer såväl nationellt som internationellt. Den kommersiella avdelningen består av två sektioner och som affärsanalytiker blir du en del av Marknadssektionen som idag består av nio personer.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning**
 Försvarsmakten arbetar kategoristyrt för att tillgodose myndighetens behov och säkerställa robusta försörjningskedjor. Som affärsanalytiker är du en nyckelperson i att bevaka, analysera och utveckla vår försörjningsberedskap ur ett kommersiellt perspektiv. Du arbetar tvärfunktionellt och samarbetar nära andra experter inom logistik, inköp och verksamheten. För att lyckas i rollen förutsätts att du har en mycket god förmåga att tillgodogöra dig stora mängder information och data som du på ett pedagogiskt och tydligt sätt kan analysera, sammanfatta och presentera. Rollen innebär vidare ett lösningsorienterat och pragmatiskt arbetssätt för att kunna navigera på en strategisk nivå och snabbt kunna sätta dig in i verksamhetens behov. Till hög grad kommer du att analysera kommersiella flöden, identifiera risker, trender och avvikelser i kommersiella försörjningskedjor. Rollen innebär att du kan arbeta systematiskt med uppföljning och utveckling.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* bevakning och uppföljning av trender, hot och avvikelser i kommersiella försörjningskedjor
* arbeta tvärfunktionellt för att identifiera försörjningsrisker och -brister
* delta i utvecklingen av metoder och arbetssätt för omvärldsanalys inom kommersiell försörjning
* sammanställa och analysera stora mängder data
* stödja i tvärfunktionella projekt kring utveckling av försörjnings- och inköpsstrategier
* alternativgenerera försörjningslösningar för att säkerställa trygga leveranskedjor


**KRAV**
**Kvalifikationer**
* akademisk examen inom ekonomi, logistik, industriell ekonomi eller motsvarande
* god analytisk förmåga
* mycket god förmåga i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* mycket goda kunskaper i Excel och PowerPoint


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi värdesätter att du som person är lösningsorienterad mer än problematiserande och har en god förmåga att förstå helheten men samtidigt kunna fokusera på detaljerna. Du har lätt för att knyta nya kontakter såväl inom som utanför den egna organisationen och trivs med ett omväxlande och utmanande arbete. Vidare tar du ansvar och driver ditt arbete framåt för att nå goda resultat. Stor vikt kommer läggas vid personlig lämplighet med rätt attityd, värderingar och inställning.
   

  

**MERITERANDE**
* erfarenhet av kategoristyrt inköp
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med identifiering och hantering av risker i försörjningskedjor
* erfarenhet från försörjningsarbete i större eller komplexa organisationer
* erfarenhet av supply chain management eller strategiskt inköpsarbete


 För att myndighetens uppdrag ska vara framgångsrikt förutsätts att alla medarbetare uppträder enligt den värdegrund som finns. Försvarsmaktens värdegrund slår vakt om alla människors lika värde, rättvisa och jämlikhet och främjar demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter (läs mer på www.forsvarsmakten.se).
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Anställningsform: Anställningen är ett tidsbegränsat föräldravikariat om nio månader, med eventuell möjlighet till förlängning.
   

  

 Befattningen är en civil anställning.
   

  

 Individuell lönesättning tillämpas.
   

  

 Resor i tjänsten förekommer.
   

  

 Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 %/heltid.
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm.
   

  

 Tillträdesdatum: Snarast/enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 I intervjuprocessen ingår arbetsprover.
   

  

**Upplysningar om befattningen och rekryteringsprocessen**
 Martin Westman på telefon 072-383 13 73.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 OFR/O HKV Arne Nilsson
   

  

 SACO HKV Stefan Ungerth
   

  

 OFR/S HKV Kjell Tetzlaff
   

  

 SECO HKV Monika Danielsson
   

  

 Ovan personer nås via växeln 08-788 75 00
   

  

**Ansökan**
**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-06-16. Din ansökan ska innehålla CV och ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning samt svar på angivna urvalsfrågor.**
**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 ----------------------------------------------------- Information om det rekryterande förbandet: I Högkvarteret finns överbefälhavaren och generaldirektören. Högkvarteret har ungefär 1 000 medarbetare – både yrkesofficerare och civila experter. Högkvarteret utgörs från 2023-01-01 av försvarsstaben, operationsledningen, militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten, samt Högkvarterets stabsavdelning och fristående enheter för tillsyn. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Senior Internal Auditor
description:
**Shape the future. Bring your potential to life.**
 Are you naturally analytical and driven by curiosity? Do you thrive on traveling the world, connecting with senior leaders, and gaining a deep understanding of business operations?
   

  

 We are seeking a Senior Internal Auditor to join our Commercial & Operations Internal Audit team. In this role, you'll play a critical part in helping Electrolux achieve its strategic goals by conducting audits across the Group. You'll work closely with senior leaders and regional teams worldwide, identifying key risks and delivering independent, data-driven insights to optimize business performance.
   

  

*Based at our headquarters in Stockholm, you will have a global scope, with regular international travel to Electrolux offices and sites.*
**About The Role**
 As part of Group Internal Audit, you will stay ahead of internal and external developments, ensuring that risks are effectively identified and mitigated. Your focus will be on Commercial & Operations processes, assessing risk areas related to errors, inefficiencies, and fraud.
   

  

 You will design audit work programs and perform audit assignments, providing independent assurance on critical processes while delivering actionable insights for continuous improvement. Additionally, you will monitor data, trends, and emerging risks to refine audit strategies and support risk-based decision-making. Performing risk assessment activities to build the internal audit plan for the Commercial and Operations area will also be part of your responsibilities.
   

  

 You will be based at our Global headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden but your field of responsibility spans our worldwide operations, and you will be travelling to Electrolux offices and sites all around the world. You will report to the Internal Audit Manager Commercial & Operations.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Leading and executing audit assignments, assessing process integrity and effectiveness.
* Interface with leadership across Electrolux, presenting findings, recommendations, and risk insights in addition to review progress of open issues
* Conducting risk assessments, using interviews, data analysis, and audit history to shape audit priorities.
* Testing internal controls, evaluating their effectiveness and suggesting enhancements.
* Driving innovation in audit processes, including leveraging technology for smarter risk detection and analysis.


**Who you are:**
* At least 7 years of relevant experience, ideally in internal audit, risk management, or financial controls.
* You have a sharp eye for detail and a strong ability to analyze complex processes, risks, and data. Proficient in data analytics tools like Qlik, Power BI, or Tableau, and understand how technology enhances audits.
* Exceptional communication skills. You confidently engage with stakeholders at all levels, translating audit findings into meaningful insights.
* You take initiative, drive improvements, and find practical solutions to challenges.
* Internationally minded - You thrive in a global environment and are fluent in English (additional languages are a plus).
* A CIA certification is a strong advantage, or you have a clear plan to obtain it.
* Master’s or bachelor’s degree in Economics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.


**Some of our benefits include:**
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work environment
* Discounts on award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family-friendly benefits, including extended paternity leave (4 weeks)
* Comprehensive insurance policy
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career paths


**As part of Electrolux, we are committed to investing in your development, with no limits to where your career can take you.**

title: Payments – Senior Business Consultant
description:
We are looking to recruit an experienced Senior Business Analyst - Payments with experience to work alongside our clients to recommend solutions and identify/resolve challenges within the programmes.
   

  

 You will be working with some of CGI’s key Banking clients on global market leading solutions. When you start your CGI story, not only will you be improving people’s lives, you can be sure we’ll do the same for you.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Collaborate with Business Owners in defining & prioritizing the requirements.
* Participate & drive shaping up roadmap and direction for building the payment solutions for the future.
* Support sales team in understanding the customer needs and tailoring the offerings.
* Be part of highly skilled payment experts’ team to meet high expectations from our customers.
* Be ready for continuous learning & growth in the organization.
* Help develop enterprise solutions that take into consideration operational costs, security, application development, production support considerations and client experience considerations.
* Lead workshops with business and technology stakeholders to review, develop, validate and finalise requirements for the delivery of ISO compliance across the business. Then ensure all agreed outputs and decisions are suitably well documented in the agreed tools throughout the requirements lifecycle, from initial capture through various stages of refinement, through to testing and implementation.
* Work with architects and delivery leads to pursue strategic solutions in the context of ongoing project delivery pressures, requiring strong powers of influence, diplomacy and pragmatism.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 As a senior business consultant you have in-depth understanding of the business aspects of payments in- and outside of the bank. Your experiences covers areas such as different payment types (domestic bulk payments, cross border payments, instant payments, high value payments), this in a Nordic environment.
   

  

 Extensive payment processing experience within a bank covers areas such as validation of transactions, checking of limits, exchange rates, postings, account statements and interaction with the GL.
   

  

 You have also technical experience such as XSD/XML knowledge, APIs, SQL, technical interactions with back-office systems of various kinds. Testing of these integrations and other processing steps. You also have experiences in working with UML and/or BPMN. It is an advantage if you also have experiences from Blockchain/DLT, CBDC, Open Banking and GDPR.
   

  

 Certifications, or experiences, in ISO 20022 is required. This will typically cover CBPR+ and HVPS+ as well as schemes such as SEPA (bulk and Instant) and NPC (bulk and Instant).
   

  

 Agile certifications are to be considered an advantage, or at least experiences of working in an agile delivery.
   

  

 You are comfortable leading virtual teams and able to influence and direct people without direct line management responsibility, you are also experienced in organizing and leading workshops focused on requirements gathering, analysis and refinement.
   

  

 You possess strong communication and presentation skills and an ability to build and maintain excellent relationships with business stakeholders and gain trust in order guide and influence them.
   

  

 You will have experiences of payment infrastructures such as TIPS, Target2, Euro1, Step2, RT1, Swift and Nordic legacy infrastructures.
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Vi söker en driven
 **Service** 
**Delivery Manager** 
 som vill utveckla våra kunders IT-leveranser utifrån kundernas olika förväntningar. Ditt ansvar kommer vara att säkerställa en kvalitativ kundleverans samt att utveckla våra kunder framåt på den konstanta IT-resan! I denna roll säkerställer du att kundens verksamhets- och IT-behov identifieras, hanteras och utvecklas.
 



  





 Som Service Delivery Manager
 
 ansvarar du för att kundens verksamhets- och IT-behov identifieras och möts i tid. Du driver utveckling genom att lyfta leveransen och kunden till nästa nivå, identifiera förbättringsförslag och initiera nya projekt. Som länk mellan olika grupper, både inom och utanför leveransorganisationen, säkerställer du att vi når våra mål och KPI:er.
 



  





 Du har en nyckelroll i dialogen med kunden och ansvarar för att bygga och underhålla en stark relation med beställaren. Genom regelbundna, proaktiva möten driver du samarbetet framåt, säkerställer en strukturerad uppföljning och dokumenterar beslutsunderlag.
 



 Utöver kundansvaret arbetar du aktivt med bolagsutveckling. Du granskar och godkänner förändringar enligt Change-processen, identifierar förbättringsområden i leveransorganisationens processer och rutiner samt koordinerar framtagandet av
 **förvaltningsplaner** 
 och
 **IT** 
**RoadMaps.** 




  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Minst
 **5 års erfarenhet** 
 av en liknande roll, t.ex. Service Delivery Manager, IT-projektledare eller IT-försäljning
* Stark
 **kommunikationsförmåga** 
 och erfarenhet av att hantera
 **kunddialoger**
* Erfarenhet av att
 **koppla samman verksamhetsbehov med IT-lösningar**
* Vana av att
 **driva förändring och förbättra processer**
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT-förvaltning
* **Flytande** 
 svenska i tal och skrift
* **Goda kunskaper i engelska i tal och skrift**



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 



* Kommunikativ och relationsskapande
* Lösningsorienterad med en stark servicekänsla
* Trygg i sin erfarenhet och vågar ta initiativ
* **Strukturerad** 
 och skicklig på att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt



  





**Meriterande** 



* Erfarenhet av
 **ITIL** 
 eller liknande ramverk
* Erfarenhet av arbete i en
 **komplex IT-miljö**
* Teknisk bakgrund inom IT



  





 Vill du vara en del av ett härligt bolag och vår fortsatta resa med att lyfta kund och leverans till nästa nivå är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**Varför välja oss som din nästa arbetsgivare:** 




**Flexibilitet!** 
 Hos oss betyder work-life balance att du kan jobba halva veckan där det passar dig bäst – hemma, på café eller på kontoret!
 



**Kunniga kollegor** 
 Välkommen till ett företag där IT är själva kärnan i vår verksamhet. Få möjlighet att jobba med grymma kollegor som brinner för IT (kanske lika mycket som du gör). "101 % för dig" är vårt mantra, oavsett om det gäller dig som medarbetare eller våra kunder.
 



**Rätt storlek -** 
 Vad är rätt storlek, kanske du undrar? För oss innebär rätt storlek att vi är stora nog att erbjuda utvecklingsmöjligheter men samtidigt små nog för att varje medarbetares insats ska göra skillnad.
 



**Teknikpeng -** 
 Hos oss får du välja din egen utrustning när du börjar, och varje år får du en summa att spendera på de senaste prylarna – så att du alltid ligger steget före!
 



  





 Är du nyfiken på att höra mer om QD som arbetsgivare? Lyssna här ➡
 
 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7DdWlG3PGGMcv9AHlblHxg?si=1c6dbe944a474da0
 




 I så fall vill vi gärna lära känna dig bättre genom att ställa några frågor och ta en titt på ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Vi tror på en fördomsfri rekrytering, så inget personligt brev behövs. En bakgrundskontroll genomförs innan anställningsbeslut.

title: Head of Data Insights&Analytics
description:
Join us to deliver a smoke- free future as Head Data Insights & Analytics
   

  

 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and have been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years.
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,600 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway working in various functions and teams and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 The Head of Data & Analytics is the primary advisor to the Managing Director and his direct reports on all data-related matters. This role involves contributing to business discussions, setting the vision and strategy for data and analytics (D&A) within the market, and leading the analytics team. The role ensures mastery of the local data value chain from acquisition, storage, curation, analytics, to embedding insights into business processes.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Developing & implementing a comprehensive Spoke-level D&A strategy aligned with business goals and overall D&A strategy. Setting the vision for data and analytics within the market.
* Leading and inspiring a diverse team of data professionals. Fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation.
* Acting as the go-to person for the Managing Director and his direct reports. Challenging and supporting business discussions with data-driven insights.
* Managing senior stakeholders, demonstrating strong negotiation skills. Communicating complex data insights effectively to non-technical partners.
* Overseeing the entire data value chain from acquisition to insights embedding within the market. Ensuring data quality, security, and compliance through robust data governance frameworks.
* Apply advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and data visualization to derive actionable insights. Embedding insights into business processes to drive decision-making.
* Overseeing complex data projects, ensuring timely and within-budget delivery. Promoting the ethical use of data, considering privacy and legal implications.
* Maintaining a strong understanding of data technologies, databases, and analytics tools. Staying updated with evolving technologies and industry trends.


 Who you are
   

  

* Advanced degree or equivalent experience in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field.
* Proven experience in a senior data leadership role.
* Minimum +5 years of experience in a similar role.
* Strong track record of implementing data strategies and leading analytics teams.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* In-depth knowledge of data governance and ethical data use.


 Please note that relocation support is not available for this job.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 Our Success Depends On The Dedicated People Who Come To Work Every Single Day With a Sense Of Purpose And An Appetite For Progress. Join Swedish Match And You Too Can
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future!
